epitome cronicles conteyninge whole discourse history well realme england al coūtreys succesion kinges time reigne notable actes much profitable redde namelye magistrate haue auctoritee commō weales gathered probable auctours firste thomas lanquet beginning worlde incarnacion christe secondely reigne soueraigne lord king edward sixt thomas cooper thirdly reigne soueraigne ladye quene elizabeth robert crowley anno 1559 londini aedibus thomae marshe ¶ ryghte hyghe myghtye prynce edward grace god duke somerset gouernour kynges maiestees royall person protectour hyghnesse realmes dominion subiectes thomas cooper wysheth wealth perfite felicitie al righte excellente prince affabilltye clemencie great people euery state degree well poore riche maye conueniente time haue free accesse grace haue reasonable suite complayntes peticions benignely heard accordynge equitee iustice good conscience depeched therby verye likely true knowledge state condicion weale publike tymes grace reueled opened yet well nere common weales aboute suche noble good prince haue ben owne commoditee aduancement displeasure affection haue letted hindered true report could frankly come foorthe thyng much feared wisedome prudence foresene lest might perchance hereafter couertly crepe fauour flatterye dissimulacion would endeuour abuse godly gentilnesse suche haue dooen like nature vertuous worthie gouernours tyme meanes onely blemyshe greatly immortal prayses grace shoulde moost woorthily deserue men godly politike gouernaunce also tourne noble realme muche trouble hindrance neuer chaunce greatter mischiefe comm • n weale neuer vertuous nature greate ruler soone corrupted either haue ben misinstructed wronge infourmed flatterer el moste fauour credyte dissimu • ing trueth stede equitee iustice haue wrought owne purpose good kyng darius wicked persuasiōs induced euen conscience committe daniel prophete god daunger cruell hungrie lion diuelish counsaile haman persuaded assuerus without cause destroy whole nacion iewes malice bare mardocheus ne singuler prouydence god hester preserued theim misgouernaunce vicious liuyng perennius cleander bring emperour commodus notwithstanding graue sage counsailours lefte hym father marcus antonius thing much corrupte nature valiant conqueroure alexander greatly blemish fame glorye eares open flatterer whiche made hym thinke sonne greate god iupiter yea almoste god mortall man wherfore wyse emperour gordian good cause saie wretched prince v ertuous counsaile trueth matter hidde flatery yea mine opinion farre tollerable soueraine euyll selfe hys nere friendes seruauntes famylyars whome trusteth bee flatterer couetous malisyous suche person shal onely theim selfes dooe muche euyl also false informacion corruptinge high ruler possible allure hym dooe lyke peryll daunger bothe hym selfe weale publike therfore wisemen haue alwayes iudged worthie extremely punished example al like noble emperour alexander sharpe iustice named seuerus caused vetronnis thurinus smoke smuddered death matter suite taken bribe false reporte emperours fauour noble gouernour suspecting eueil long wold ere wilie way subtile • nardes maye spyed may lightly misledde • wold wist surely truth went daunger hath alwayes bene much thynge feared witty men perceyuyng thinges suchewise mishandled theim great fauour prince durst least wold speake discouer greuous hurtes commen weale feare hindred familiar lose dignitees office auctoritees great hope reporte commended therby aduaunced promocion high roome common weale gather hereby righte excellente prince thinge mooste difficile harde rule well chiefe magistrate gouernour truly without dissimulacion informed euerye case notable saying king antiochus doth well declare time hunting strayed company benighted fayne take harborowe poore cotage countrey vnknowen supper vplandishe people communication heard diuers thinges frelye talked owne behauour therfore morow minister brought purpre raiment diademe tourning ensignes sayed sin time first began yesterday neuer herd truth frankly spoken wherfore best sure waye noble gouernour counsaile excellent philosopher demetrius reade bookes wittily pithilye treate state common weales namely history shall playnelye see sette foorth eye best beseemeth dooe eschew maye aduaunce state common weale maye hurte hynder howe meanes hatred grudge bredde toward howe wayes maye wynne loue fauour maketh realme weake maketh stronge maketh wealthye riche maketh poore beggarly maketh floryshe many yeres▪ maketh miserable short space bookes shall lerne know wilie flattering fox sure trustye friendes good faythfull minister false feigning dissembler ought chose counsaylours lawes ought make thus saye shall learne bookes bee selfe selfe best trustest surest counsaylour thys consyderacion wold wish summes lerned workes drawen short brigementes ende prudent gouernours whych theyr manyfolde affayres business haue small tyme leisure myghte liew playes passe tyme therwyth like epitome brigemente cronycles whych many yeeres passed begunne studious yong man named thomas lanquet nowe late finished▪ continued incarnacion christ seconde yere reigne soueraine lord king edvvard sixt •• che forme ordre diligent reader may mirrour behold state condicion realmes time know gouernours ruled theim many yeres reygned notable actes done time reigne whan britaines likewyse scottes came fyrste thys lande succession kinges whole discourse historyes countreis ye may perceiue notable acte done realme vnder euery king england yere reigne yeres kinges land noted margent wyth yere worlde christe computacyon wee haue folowed moste sure accompte byble hebrew whiche dyffereth muche eusebius latine croniclers labour suche excellent prince thought conuenient publish grace name wel handling yet iudged worthie noble prince onely dyd late exhibite correction sir thomas eliotes dictionarie kinges royall maiestee testifie louing obedient herte toward highnesse doe nowe offer symple gyfte grace witnesse testimonie good zeale loue whiche men ought well beare toward christian vertuous gouernance especially godly zeale aduancyng true religion christ wishing continually hertie prayer gouerning v benignely mercifully godly mought alwaye liue moste happy felicitee bringe diuersitee opinion 276280281 zulemon 169 zuuentebaldus 181 finis ¶ thus endeth table made spedie findyng name thyng ye woulde seke epitome cronicles numbre leafe many place •• er • man spoken intent ye shulde spende muche tyme serchyng desire know ¶ vse profite historyes iudgement oughte bee redde albeit many cavses whyche shall hereafter recyte readyng hystoryes doth indifferently auayle men yet moste specyallye perteyneth kynges greatte prynces whose boke maye worthely called knowledge thereof moste profitable necessary whyche haue gouernaunce cōmune weales onely hystoryes gentile also holy scryptures doo euerye place make mencyon theym holy scryptures besydes make v certayne wyll woorde god also spyrytuall kyngedome chryste teache v polyticall administracion set forth many notable example rulynge publyke weale necessary bee knowen whereby myndes prynces maye styerred study true nobilitye vertue hystoryes gentyles declare orygynall begynnynge greate empyres cause hathe chaunced theim gret straung alteration greuous commocyons also conteyned preceptes offyces vertues whereby commune weales may prosperousely preserued contynued aduaunced thys cause hystoryes moost worthy called bookes good princis noble men nowe forasmuche vnto euery prynce belongeth double vertue politicall externall fayth feare towarde god exaumples bothe shewed v hystoryes therefore wyll fyrste speake ciuyle vertues prince yea haue auctorytye greate affaire hyghe matter oughte example actes chyefelye consyder wherby maye admonyshed meanes maye mooste prosperouslye exercyse selfes gouernance weale publike must sette eye example good kinges ruler must lerne necessary dutye vpryght trade gouerning empyers reignes besides vtilitie benefyte publyke weale regarded nothing▪ iustice equitie onely enbraced misdemeanour offence greuously punished agayne towardes good men pecible alwayes beneficiall gentyl euery cause woulde rayse vp warres wynkinge iniuryes reteyne peace yet defence theyr royalmes neuer lesse inuincible courage redye finally wysedome power strength defended dominion outward hostilitye true religyon welth quietnes necessarye artes made flouryshe whiche quality excellent gracious prince henrye eyghte hath excelled example theym whiche shall succeede hym alone coniested heaped sundry good quality auncient kynges whyche opteyned great renome whyche qualityes hath practysed gouernaunce hys realme suppose neuer common weale noble prince gouernoure whiche hath declared mo example wisedome shewed mo benefites pleasure hys countrey hys grace hath purpose contrary parte ¶in example tyrannes maye obserue dyuers thynges ende miserable▪ theyr crueltie many mischefes daungerous cōmocions haue chaunced theyr common weales appereth pharao tyrany peryshed lyke cause romain kynges exiled prince haue oftentymes distroyed one pryde disdain enuy many tymes begun vpon nothyng euen cause cruel warres betwene cesar pompei romayne hystoryes shew desyre noueltie hath oft stirer moost greuous warres sect reygne machomet none begynnyng heresy dissencion artycles fayth auaileth muche bee auctoritye marke thynges redynge hystoryes▪ lerne beware foresee auoyde lyke thynges gouernance chance daily happen persones nowe chaunged commune weales ne uerthelesse pertaynynge similitude busynes trouble worlde remayneth worlde lyke vnto selfe therfore truly thucydides man excellente knowledge warrefare also wrate greatte longe warre sundrye thyges whiche chanced among grekes sayth hystoryes treasure whiche ought neuer handes therby beynge ayded maye commodiously handle suche busynesse like chaunces commune weale much cause often tymes chaunce almoste lyke ¶furthermore axaumples founde hystoryes conuenient euery man priuately degree magistrate ought obeyede neuer escaped vnpunished whiche haue rebelled theym euen dathan absalom catiline brutus cassus suche lyke sedicion haue ben worthily punished fidelitie frendes ionathas saued lyfe kynge dauyd punyshment homicide adulterye suche lyke offence appereth example dauid shal nede many wordes euen euery arte paternes geuen folowe lykewyse hystoryes peinted eye example kyndes vertues yet example deedes euydently perceyued dignytye vertue agayne bacenesse dyshonestee vyces bee bare preceptes example set image v onely openly teache also bothe warne stirre myndes therby wyth certayne delite desyre kyndled towardes vertue honestie hert stubborne hard moued rede anye thynge notable either worthy prayse el exāples vtterly abhorryd haue shewed briefely readyng hystoryes example politicall vertues ciuyle affayres ought bee obserued nowe perteyneth true christen man aboue thynges oughte esteeme godlynesse knowe maye gather also hysteryes example faythe feare god specyall vertues good men syghte god moste auailable al hystoryes gentyles doo teache god careth hath oughte wyth v yet godly mynde neuerthelesse shall consyder publyke weales worlde conserued power god worke god punyshe reuenge oppressyon vyolence ye vnto heathen god gyueth excellent quality prince preserue empyers agaynst assaultes sathan wythout syngular benefyt god ayde theyr owne vertue wisedome thys maner good man maye well suppose actes punishmentes w • rkes god therby may lern feare god tyrannes haue greuousely punyshed accordynge thys sentence taketh sworde whyche wythout auctorytye vsurpeth ryght reuengyng shall peryshe sworde contrarywyse euydent good prynces bee preserued defended god also ethnykes well perceyue theyr prince great affiaunce helpe theyr goddes homere poete sayth god casteth sh • elde batayle defende prynces feigneth also euery prynce vnder protectyon god appereth goddesse pallas whyche alw • yes presente wyth achilles thynge playnely expressed hystoryes holy scrypture noe abraham moses dauyd ezechias prince kinges god alwayes preserued example set eies prince maye certaynly know lyke maner god wyll defende good kinges thys difference betwene holy prophane hystoryes shewed testymonies workes god whiche onely entreate cyuile matter chiefly doo represente vnto v kyngdome god god geueth word mercy wyll saue v wher hystoryes gentile ignorant therfore principally hystoryes holy scripture ought knowen chrysten men therby maye learne doctryne stablishement faithe ¶ fyrst thynges created god originall synne agaynst synne christe instituted kyngdome gaue hys woorde shoulde come take away sinne saue v also god whā gyuen worde preserued alwayes reygne chryst reigne christe true beleuers begynnynge worlde walked vnder crosse neuerthelesse pre serued sathā wyth power worlde assaulted worde god moreouer god meruaylously perfourmed hys promyse aboue opinyon capacitie man wytte also example bothe horyble vengeance also grace forgyuenes shewed v god vnto kyng dauid chanced remission syns theyr example myghte bee comforted beleue god wyll forgyue neyther thys neglected confyrmacion myndes god hath geuen v sortes prophecy externall kyngdomes fulfillying maye haue testimony woorde god neyther faythe true maye bee admonyshed whan christ ought come whan consummacion worlde shall finally ryghte vnderstandyng prophecyes shall expedyent knowe successe alteracion monarchy kyngdomes wyth computacyon noumber yeres whyche hystoryes gentile exactly set foorth •• knowledge wherof euen thys cause necessarie chrystians maie better vnderstande prophecyes th • • certaynely iudge certes euery man maye thynges esteme pleasure profyte gathered readynge hystoryes fruitefull commoditye therof ought worthily stire compell euery man knowe ¶of origynall begynnynge man false opynion ethnike philosophier phisosophyer auncyent tyme wythout knowledge verye true godhead many hundred yeres gone haue sette oute historyes writynge diuers opynions concernyng originall begynnyng man forsome beleued worlde haue thynge vncreated saye without begynnyng incorruptible neuer haue ende lykewyse mankynde haue eternall continuance theim opynion worlde created corruptyble auouched man toke begynnyng generacion succession tyme imagynacion fyrst begynnyng thynges▪ bothe skye earthe bad one sole sourme shape nature one wyth intermingled proces body disseuered vniuersal worlde haue receiued thys order whiche se thys presente fyrste ayre haue founde continuall mouynge fyry parte thereof reason lyghtnesse haue mounted highest place sonne sterres cause haue gotten theyr course myngled wyth moysture stylle haue remayned fyrst place reason heuy coulde ryse whyche inferior thynges beyng mixed heaped together commixtion sea haue ben produced moyste lyquyde thynges harder stuffe matter▪ erth conclusion haue remained clammy nesh whan erthe fyrste begynnynge feruente heate sonne settled growen thycker massy substance vppermoste partes wythin shorte space power heate swelled littel bunch certayn humoures manye sundrye place gathered congeled together selfe whyche humour dyd aryse certayn corrupcyons rottennes couered througheout lyttell thynne scumme creame lyke chaunceth marsh egypte deade standynge pooles whan feruente heate ayre dooeth sodeynely parche colde earthe whan heate commethe moyste thynges anone wroughte generatyon reasone nyghte tyme ayre rounde aboute enuyronneth wyth humoure whyche daye vertue soonne made harde certayne space tyme sayed putryfactyons beynge broughte vttermooste extente approchynge tyme delyuerance soone sayd scummes crea • e throughly dried broken broughte forthe shape kyndes lyuynge thynges whereof suche chaunce receyued heate beynge made apt flight • ▪ • unted vp ayre remayning erth becam crepers grounde beastes earth suche hapned haue watryshe nature caryed element proper kynde named fyshes earthe partely wyth parchynge heate sonne partlye wyth wyndes warynge styll drier dryer surcessed bryngyng foorthe beastes great quantitye alredye ingendred broughte foorthe others eche owne kynde mutuall cōmirtion engendrynge one wyth selfe wyse saye man also fyrst begynnyng produced seekinge foode wylde fieldes long tyme lyued saluage rude lyfe vnto whome onely fruicte grasse tryes dyd selfe myn • ster sustynaunce sayen furthermore wylde beastes noyefull vnto men whiche beastes withstande assembled theym companyes feare sayde beastes common vtilytie mutuall ayde succur myght bee ministred one sought oute place inhabite sowne theyr mouth suche myght vnderstande made distinction one word littell lyttel called eche thynge seuerall name albeit muche thei placed sundry corner region worlde vsed maner wordes speach therfore saye phylosophers sundrye fourmes facyons letter companiss men fyrste essembled reporte haue ben fyrst progenitours euery company owne nacion fyrst men hauynge maner staye helpe succoure liued harde lyfe hadde knowledge prouision saue laye vp fruytes fyeldes occupye afterwardes time neede hereof chaunced wynter season veraye many eyther famyne el reason colde peryshed proces tyme beynge well taught experyence bothe soughte caues lye aduoydyng defendyng extreme sharpnesse co • de also began kepe fruites store 〈◊〉 knowlage fyre thynges man vse necessarye perceyued lerned commodityes mannes lyfe shorte space founde finally necessitye beynge made schol • maystres thynges ministred vnto wittes euery singular persone cunnyng expert practisyng vnto also geuen adiutours helpe handes speeche communicacion excellency mynde phylosophiers whyche throughly perswaded orygynall begynnynge man dyd referre pro • ydence god auouched ethiopes fyrste men euer folowyng coniecture soyle ethiopia began part e erthe encrease warmethe reason sonne nerest erthe selfe da • kyshe moyst wherby happened fyrst proporcion attempring moysture heate man ingendred man hys pr • cr •• cyon dyd wyth better wyll apytyte holde hym selfe parte earthe hapned hym procreate seke muche thynges vnto hym yet vnoknwen ¶ whyche suppose scithians fyrst people worlde betwene egyptian long contencion whether nacion antiquytie aegyptians • dgynge theym begynnynge thynges whan contraryes feruente heate sonne • u • n parched burned agayne extreme colde frosen coulde ingend • r men yet receyue susteyne inhabitauntes garmentes inuented saue bodye violence colde heate yll place remedye mollified aegypte alwayes haue temperate neyther winter colde somer heate myght greue hir inhabitantes grounde beyng moreouer fruitfull lande fertile nouryshmentes man vse therfore reason semeth men shulde fyrst ingender myght moste easely nouryshed ¶on parte scithyans supposed temperatenes ayre argumente antiquitee nature whan deuided colde heate regyons forthwith ingendred creature apt suffer qualityes place yea tree fruytes herbes accordyng disposicyon regyons howe muche sharper ayre scithians aegypcians muche harder bodye wyt moreouer worlde whyche nowe deuyded elementes hath ben confused one eyther water begynnynge sourroundyng al thynges elles fyre whiche also ingendred world possessynge scithians originall bothe begynnynges anciente fyre fyrste possessed thynges whiche lyttell lytell quenched gaue place earth place soone disseuered fyre colde wynter northe muche nowe lande vehement colde aegypt al east long ere temperate bycause nowe euen seared feruent heat sonne yf erthe firste couered wyth water certes highest partes water assuagynge fyrst discouered lowest groundes dyd longest abyde sooner euerye parte earthe dry muche sooner began bryng foorth lyuynge creature sc • thia soo hyghe ouer countreys water seeme sprynge falle greate meere meotis whence runneth sea pontus aegypt aegypt long time hath ben defended care charge manye kynges fortified greate bankes agaynst violence watres trenched many dyches water kepte one place may receiued another coulde inhabited onlesse nilus helde seme antitiquitie rather appeareth la • e countrey either heapynges kynges el castynge vp mudde nilus argumentes aegyptians beynge ouercome scithya alwaye haue ben reputed ancient people amonge gentyles nowe wyll leaue wryte vayne fantasye ethnykes whyche haue sette foorth intent reders maye perceyue blynde iudgmente theym whyche wythout knowledge god scryptures woulde define origynall man consequentlye wyll begynne fyrst booke creation man accordynge sette foorth holy scryptures aucthoritee certayntee whereof moste sure whiche wyll continue vntill tyme abraham durynge whiche tyme worlde stode without prescript administracion certayne lawe onely ledde lawe nature thys hystorye shall vse order shall deuide booke thre age whiche fyrste shall conteyne thinges done betweene tyme adam abraham seconde frome abraham vnto comynge christ thirde frome incarnacion christ vnto present tyme ¶ fyrst parte lanquettes chronicle holye scryptures dooe shewe whan heauen earth furnytures therof created syxte daye adam mooste excellente creature god almyghty made slyme earthe breathed breathe lyfe soule wherby made like vnto image god yere worlde 1 yere christe 3682 unto moste perfecte man god gaue suche grace without instruction onely indowmentes origynall ryghtuousnes foorthewyth perfectly seene learned lyberall artes inspired also wyth knowledge nature herbes tree mettalles stone byrdes beastes fysshes wormes creature moreouer vnto hym god gaue power ouer thynges earthe sea vnto beastes fowles fyshes wormes adam dyd geue propre conuenient name accordyng nature theym euen called daye broughte almyghty lorde pleasaunte place paradyse replenyshed pleasure felicitye whiche place augustine dooeth thys wyse descryue man lyued paradyse wolde howe longe willed whiche god cōmanded lyued hauyng fruicyon god whyche goodnesse good lyued without necessitie beyng power alwayes haue lyued meate ready shulde hunger drynke would thyrst wood lyfe age shulde dyssolue hym hys flesshe perfecte healthe hys mynde lesse tranquillytie paradyse neyther heate ne colde inhabitantes offence good nothyng sorowfull nothyng vainely glad true ioye continued god towarde whome pure herte issued charitye concorde mynde watching bodye without anye laboure custody commaundement myght ocupye hym selfe necessitie recreacion receyued 〈…〉 tree paradyse 〈…〉 eate absteined frō tre knowlage good euil th • god perceiuing yet ther creature made like vnto man might helper companion vnto forth caste adam slumber toke ryb hys syde fyllyng place fleshe wherof made woman brought vnto hym whome whan adam sawe saied nowe bone bone fleshe fleshe shalbe called woman taken man vvher fore man shall forsake father mother shall cleane vnto vvyfe shalbe tvvo one fleshe lorde blessed sayed encrease multiply fyll erth subdue it▪ ye lorde ouer fyshes see foules ayre beastes moue earth man whan hygh felicitye coulde perceyue thorough craft enuious serpent whyche lyttle outragious pryde dryuen heauen prouocatyon woman transgressed commaundemente gyuen hym god wherfore driuen paradyse made subiecte deathe synne kyndes misery earth restreygned shulde bringe forth fruites selfe sweat paynfull labor shoulde leade lyues came syckenesse vppon theym heate could began assayle theyr tender bodyes whan thei began synne god dyd open power sathan agaynst hym seede woman promised christe shuld come destroy power sathan deliuer v free death synne thys fyrst declaracion gospell whyche began kyngdome christe churche adam eua tooke comforte promyse chryste two person churche beganne ¶after thus exiled paradyse holy scripture testifye thei broughte forth chyldren cayn fyrste begotten many abell two bretherne founder two contrary cityes babell hierusalem one vnderstande confusyon vysion peace father taughte theim feare god worshyp hym sacryfyces cayne vnhappy dysposicion geuen vnto vice firste tylled earthe offered alwayes mooste vyle thynges vnto god abell yonger contrary condycions gaue hym selfe vertue thynges wente thought god present occupacion kepynge beastes gaue vnto god best thynges theyr sacryfices offryng fyer descendyng heauen foorthwith consumed brother remayned vntouched wherfore cayn perceyuynge brother god preferred hym malyce disdeine therat stirred slewe hym hystorye declared anger furye deuyll also infirmitye weakenes man besydes greuous ernest sentence iudgemente god terrible vengeance god effusyon bloude whyche long recite thys place ¶after cayne fyrste murderer fled father builded fyrste cytie orient named enoch name fyrst sonne hys chyldren inuented al kyndes craftes science fynally punyshed murder commytted perysshed suche kynde deathe ¶iuball son lamech ada wyfe first made portatyne tentes feede cattell ordered hys flockes disseuerynge shepe gotes founde certayne time whan rammes shoulde put ewe taught ¶tuball brother man singuler wytte inuented science musyke stroke noyse hammer brother tubalcayn whych smyth delyting sound hammer weight theim perceyued proporcyons tune hammer gaue thereby deuysed pryncyples musike ¶tubalcayn brother sonne lamech hys wyfe sela fyrst inuented fyndynge mettall workyng therof ¶noema also founde vse wolle wyth cardyng spynnyng weauynge therof ¶ death abell exile cayn adam whā cxxx yeres age yere worlde 131 yere christe 3831 begate seth gaue selfe vertue encrease sette foorthe glorye god seth holy father begotten whose posterytie continued posterytie cain destroied vniuersall floud iosephus wryteth adam seth made two columnes pillours one brasse stone foreseynge exterminacion thynges one power fyre vyolence greatnesse water graued therin thynges whiche hadde inuented wyth prophecyes whyche woor • e god myghte preserued shoulde remayne perpetuall mounment theyr successor declare doone wryteth furthermore diuyded yeare xii monethes fyrste obserued taught course celestiall bodyes vnpossible man wyt coulde attayne vnderstandyng hyghe diffycile thynges excepte god shewed knowlage therof ¶seth 105 yere lyfe begat enos began call vppon name lorde yere worlde 136 yere christe 3727 thys dyd father graundfather call vpon lord euer iust man called vpon wherfore properly attributed onely whyche commune good men augustyne ought vnderstande enos felowshyppe godly men lyued power worldly felicytie accordynge wyll god ¶caynan borne 91 yeare lyfe hys father enos yere worlde 326 yere christe 3637 fourthe order father adam▪ genealogy ryghtuous men begotten thirde generation fyrste generacyon seth borne seconde enos chyrde caynan forthe malalehell fyfte iared syxt enoch seuenth mathusalem eighte lamech nynth noe borne tenth adam proprely accordyng mynde augustine begynnng adam generacion formacyon neuerthelesse plasmacion adam reckned among generacions accompted fyrst seth second consequently whyche maner vsed ¶ 70 yere hys lyfe caynan begat malalehell yere worlde 379 yere christe 3567 whyche macrobius doeth onely trybute vnto egypcians shulde haue ben better attrybuted hebrues amonge whome ther alwayes certayne course yere whyche circuitie obserued yeere xii monethes nowe moneth conteyned tyme dothe hole course moone daye lykewyse xxiiii houres wherby worthely refused errours whiche woulde yeres age x tymes shorter nowe holy icrypture testifieth hee false floud began vic yeere lyfe noe xvii daye seconde moneth cessed xx daye moneth yeere folowynge whiche place xi monethe read whereby appereth fewer monethes yeare nowe lyued muche loneger nowe playne farre greater bodyes haue nowe sayncte augustyne writeth hym selfe sawe utica thicke man excedynge greatnesse myghte well haue made hundred teeth alledgeth sentence pliny longer tyme passeth lesser bodyes shall ingendred ¶malalehell lxv yeere hys lyfe begate iared yere worlde 461 yere christe 3502 hathe longe tyme questyon whether father auncyent tyme longe wythout chyldren vntyll borne whiche named genelogie whan writer holy hystorye intended come birth life noe notynge tyme successyon generacyons onely recited frome noe linially descended ¶iared 262 yere age begat enoche two enoches one fyrst sonne cayn yere worlde 623 yere christe 3340 seuenth lyne iust men name yrste cytie builded earthe holynesse later dooeth appere written hathe walked wyth god hathe prophecyed tymes come yere worlde 688 yere christe 3275 ¶in 6 • yeeres hys lyfe enoch begat mathusalem scripture doeth recite longest lyfe prefyguratyng eyght tyme resurrection whyche shal begin laste daye neuer haue ende ¶eathusalem 187 yeere hys lyfe begatte lamech yere worlde 875 yere christe whose byrthe lyued 782 yeeres dyed yere floude borne tyme whā wyckednes malyce began abounde vppon earthe onely amongest chyldren cain also amonge whiche called chyldren godly thys lamech onely iuste man also prophete whan sayed shall comfort v ¶adam fyrste father deceaced whan 930 yere age yere worlde 930 yere christe 3033 ¶enoch season god taken vp heuen▪ whiche deede dooeth manyfest vnto v immortalitye remayneth thys lyfe yere worlde 987 yere christe 2976 god wyll iudge worlde wyll saue ryghtuouse damne theim wycked yere worlde 1057 yere christe 9062 ¶lamech whan lyued 182 yeeres begate noe sayinge shall comforte v frome woorkes laboures oure handes earthe whyche lorde hath cursed ¶noe whan 500 yeeres age begatte sem cham yere worlde 1556 yere christe 2404 iapher borne one tyme fyue hundred yeere age begot none recytall byrth sonnes noe foorthwyth holy scrypture declareth occasyon floude worlde began waxe wicked rehersed amonge chyefe vice contempte god adultery crueltye whyche exercysed kyndes voluptye pleasure thus texte hath whan men began multiplye vpon earthe broughte forth daughter chyldren god seynge daughter men fayre tooke theym wyues holy scrypture calleth chyldren god whiche descended seth chyldren men whiche issued cain adam commanded child seth shulde wyse couple child cain long tyme obserued till zele loue vertue decayed god therby perceyuyng wickednes man great vpon erth repented made man suche passion god scripture speaketh v familiar worldlye maner therfore thretned destruction worlde floudde wolde therfore noe declare 120 yeres shulde come meane tyme commanded hym builde arke shoulde conteyne lengthe 300 cubites whiche exposicion hugo augustine 300 perch euery cubite geometricall beyng six cōmon cubites widenesse l perch depenesse vpper decke bottome xxx perch roufe ouer height one perche arke man power brought sea course water rysynge vp borne awaye rather diuine prouidence man policie gouerned renuynge wrecke noe began builde 523 yere lyfe floud berosus witnesseth 78 yeres vic yere seconde moneth lorde saied vnto noe seuen dayes deluge shulde fall whiche space brought arke stuffe prouision al thynges necessary hym wherat euery man laughed toke hym one madde dreamed suche floud finally written gospell thei eatyng drynkyng maried wer maried euen vnto daye noe entred arke wolde knowe vntill deluge came destroied vnknowen vnto thei dispised beleue noe shewed well woorde deede also buyldyng arke certaine declaracion therof thei without faith feare god whyche cause worthily punished thus tyme passyng 17 daye seconde moneth noe wife three sonnes theyr wiues entred arke beholde sodeinly came together vnto bestes al kindes brought thither man euen miracle god neither noe take theym suffered theym came entre ne came anye vncleane beastes two male female cleane bestes seuen foure male three female one male reserued sacrifice floud resydue kept generacion yere worlde yere christe 2307 ¶thus entred lord shut doore arke incontinēt springes sea burst windowes heauen opened rain fel continually xl dayes xl nightes water swelled rose aboue al mountaynes xv cubites lyuing creature dyed except fishe suche mighte endure bowel earth water encreased cl day xvii daye octobre arke stacke vppon mountaines armeny last daye ianiuer noe opened windowe put forth crowe streight way retourned seuen day put forth dooue came againe nyght bringinge branche oliue grene leaues neuerthelesse taryed seuen day put forth doue agayne whych neuer returned yet wold issue remained cōmaundement lord commaunded go foorth xvii daie seconde moneth wherby appeareth remayned iust yeare arke ¶berosus caldei maketh mencion floude maner famous deluge water wherby hole world perished preceded manye yeares caldians faithfully obserued write libanum great citee giantes called enoch lordes world rysing sonne tyl sonne sette trustinge hugenes strength theyr body armure thei inuented oppressed men deuised tences musical instrumentes delycacyes fedde man fleshe companied commonly theyr mother doughters sister men beastes wickednesse thei omitted many prophecied preached destruction shoulde come whiche write stone scorned al thinges one giantes wiser siria whose name noa thre sonnes samo iapeto chem theyr wiues titea pandora noela noegla fearinge destruction whiche perceiued starres began make shippe faciō arke 78 yeres floud yeare shippe finished sodeinli occean swelled sea flouddes sprynges rose aboue mountaines continual rayne fel heauens wherby mankinde perished excepte noa wyth familie saued shyp whiche water bore vp toppes mountayn cordie • wherin time remained part therof woordes berosus caldeans deceiued thinke noe forese floud bi starres diuine reuelacion ☞when noe continued yere arke▪ water beīg assuaged erth dried god commaunded come forth vnto incontinent buylded aultare offred beastes byrdes dylectable sacrifice god instituted newe worlde agayne fyrst al gaue woorde whiche promised woulde destroye worlde water confyrmacion thereof gaue rayne bowe sure token betwene man bowe expressed bothe colour water fyre one part blewe red might witnesse bothe iudgementes one past come also graunted libertee eate fleshe whiche holy father floud neuer vsed moreouer god gaue newe precepte administracion externall thinges cōmaunded plainely whosoeuer shed mannes bloud bloude spilte againe theym lawfully committed magistrate ruler man made similitude god noe faythfull vnto god father vnto mankynde hauyng space 100 yeres issue wonderfully increased beyng also throughly learned knowlage diuine humayne thynges reuolucion time history worlde passed moste specially iustice relygion deuided world thre partes whiche hym self residue life peragrated leauynge place perpetuall monumentes bothe vertue also empire inuented also vse wyne whiche made drunke laye vnhonestly discouered beyng sene cham father canaan hym scorned derision broughte twoo bretherne beholde sight moued shamefastnesse honestee couered father membres wolde see whiche whan noe perceiued blessed theim cham wolde curse lorde blessed hym therefore cursed chanaan nephewe sonne cham suppose derided also hys graundfather liued floud 350 yere sundry benefittes shewed vnto nacions gaue vnto hym diuers name among whiche famous bee celebrated noe ogyges fenix uranos coelus sol protheus ianus geminus iunonius quirinus patulcius bacchus uortumnus chaos ileton seede worlde father al goddes princis italian disceasse dedicated hym name uortumnus temple worshipped hym diuine honour ceremony also wife uesta hir great prudence benefites bteyned name erthe opis aretia uesta cybele greate mother goddis taught maydens kepe holy fyre whereof arose erroure ceremony virgin uestales residue actes shalbe declared order thei dooen ¶ vniuersall floud worlde child noe shortly replenished people god nature neuer yet fayled necessitee thynges theim arose many famous mighty nation sem prince asia called also melchisedeth iust peacible kyng priest almighty god christe liueally descended possessed asia child elam cam fyrst persian assur assyrian arphaxat chaldean aram syrian ¶cham seconde sonne noe prince aphrike called also innuus iucubus syluanus pana saturn aegypt raiser spreader wickednesse punished floude inhabited southe parte worlde familye canaan came cananees phuth libyan mezraim aegyptians chus aethiopians saba arabian iaphet prince europa called also iapetus priscus dyris maurus athlas receiued father noe porcion countreyes europe frome gades called tyme streictes marrock vnto greate ryuer tanais hym came princis nacions comerus gallus fyrst reygned italy magog came scithians turkes madaus sprange medes iauan grecian whiche called iones tuball spaniardes mosoch moscouites tyras thracian haue briefely declared parte worlde euery sonnes noe inhabited whyche vnderstandynge manye history shall beenecessary sem sonne noe yere worlde 1659 yere christe 100 yere lyfe begat arphaxat two yere floud fyrste builded citee salem called hierusalem arphaxat came chaldean arphaxat whan xxxv yeares aege yere worlde 1694 yere christe begate sale father indian sale xxx yere lyfe begat heber yere worlde 1724 yere christe lyued 403 yeres house heber continued language afore commune men whiche called hebrue ¶heber 34 yere life yere worlde 1758 yere christe 2205 begat phalech iectan liued 430 yeres phalee interpreted diuision chaunced hym borne tyme confusion tunges ¶phalech xxx yeare age begat reu liued 209 yeares fyrste yeare lyfe reu first yeare reigne nemroth babylon yere worlde 1788 yere christe raigned lvi yeares ¶after floud mankinde increased cytye towre babylon began buylded amonge chaldeis yere worlde 1757 yere christe 2206 nemroth force broughte borderer vnder subiection exhorted enterprise iectan comen stocke sem suphue one chyldren iaphet thre prince gouernance fortune hole posteritee noe ruled nemroth man veray bold eloquent tunge sayed felicitee man ought ascribed vnto god rather euerye man obteineth owne industrie cause perswaded people builde high towre ouer whiche water shuld arise top thereof reache euen heauens multitude ready fulill commaundementes nemroth esteming obeysaunce god greuous bondage builded towre soone began god foorthwith holye scripture testifieth meane dashed pride buylders many nacions gathered together number lxx vsed one language speche god confused theyr tongue euery one theim spake sundry speches one might vnderstand wherby necessitee woorke lefte vnfinished scattered abrode al world ¶after varietee tungues chaunced dyuers kyndes monstruous people brought forth sundry place augustine booke intituled ye citee god writeth maner god knowing similitude diuersitiee membres man body beaultie therof comprehended wold also bryng worlde many monstruous people therby pryde man might abated therefore euer maner men borne place creature reasonable mortal begotten man ought doubted albeit thei deformed contrary nature first monarchie vnderstand thinges done magistrate ruler ought taken honoured worke god haue warned afore ī preface god wold world gouerned iiii monarchy ye policie iustice correctiō might kept amōg mē therfore many thinges spoken scripture god set forth monarchy empire daniel two facions first vnder similitude man whose head golde breast siluer bealy brasse hys legges yron fete parte yron parte earth howe christ stone brake feete man fal world ende daniel interpreted vision signify iiii monarchy sayeth golden head signifieth first monarchie assyrian siluer breast kingdome persiās brasen bealy reygne macedon yron legges empire romains earthen yron feete betokē present state empire rome season lesse power reputacion hath bene ¶the foure beastes shewed vnto daniel signified figure monarch lion declared strength assyryans beare power persian leopard valyant courage alexander fourth beast puissaunce romaine ¶there ouer cruel kingdomes shuld rise whiche ordeine harde straight lawes religion christe whome vnderstande reygne mahomettes turkes thse dayes faithfully god remembreth v history world knowen maye consider ende therof hande meanes may establishe fayth appereth bible first kyngdome begun nemroth amonge babyloniās scripture calleth stronge hunter lorde mightye prince force brought people subiection called hunter signified deceiuer soules oppresser men withdrewe men true religion god called ¶ nemroth called also nimrod babylonicall saturne yere worlde 1788 yere christe 1175 sonne chus son cham began first empire reigned 56 yeres builded towre babell whyche lefte vnfynished finally wickednes infernal spirites rapte hell frome nemroth berosus chaldey metastenes persian began chronicle ¶ firste monarchy began among chaldeis xenophon testifieth posteritee cham reigned firste whome nemeroth beginnynge 〈◊〉 cham cursed yet god wōderfully deferred punishement promyse notwithstandyng impyre dydde continue handes posteritee nemroth among assyrian rose vp new kingdome assur niniue builded subdued citee babylon whyche diodorus siculus doeth wryte occasyon monarchy changed chaldeis assyrian strabo diuers make mencion citee niniue standeth assyria wherby maye bee easily gathered babylon niniue two sundrye city one citee called diuers name yere worlde 1797 yere christe 2166 ¶comerus gallus 33 yere fyrst arriual ianus italy 1414 yere buildyng rome brought inhabitantes royalme called italy made fyrst kynge thereof named coūtrey owne name taught theim bothe lawes iustice yere worlde 1799 yere christe 2164 ¶iubal 142 yere deluge receiuynge spain porcion builded famous citee name parte whiche nowe called granado ¶in tyme prudente samothes came fraunce first reygned ¶occeanus son cham first reygned aegipte sister thetis many chyldren came vppon corrupter mankinde cham father yere worlde 1802 yere christe 2161 aegiptian saturne corruption hys maners surnamed chamesenuus taught magike great renoume ¶gog father sabus possessed arabia yere worlde 1805 yere christe triton libia chus aethiopia getulus getulia ¶thuyscon one sonnes noe yere worlde 1812 yere christe 2151 borne floud child istus mesa enhabited countreis mountain adula ponthus great riuer tanais ryne founder sarmatians germanes two mighty nacions gaue vnto theym lawe reygned 150 yeares dyed people estemed god ¶reu 32 yeare lyfe begat saruch yere worlde 1820 yere christe ¶ianus time brought inhabitantes hyrcania mesopotamia yere worlde 1825 yere christe 2138 ¶ganges yere worlde 1828 yere christe 2135 owne name founded habitacion india certaine people came italy comerus inhabited bactria ¶nemroth babilonical saturne yere worlde 1833 yere christe 2130 sent foorth prince inhabitantes assyrius medus moscus magog inhabyted roialme assyria medium moscouia scithia ¶nowe come habitacion scithia shal briefly declare theyr historyes nacyon scithians bothe theyr originall beginninges empire lesse renoumed theyr woman theyr men thrise obtained empyre asia whiche kept tributarie vnto vntyl time nynus selfes remaining cōtinually witho ut subiection princis put shamefull flight darius king persia thei ouerthrew zopyrona capitaine alexander armye like maner slew cyrus power rather heard roman felt theym arose nacions parthian people veraie laborious hardye warres among theim crime greuous thefte hauyng substance cattell without house defence might haue nothyng sauegard yf theft sharpely punished gold syluer thei dispise muche nacions desire cō tinence hath taught theim rightuousnesse neuer desyre men goodes desyre rich vse whiche moderacion absteinyng men good wishe vnto men truely great warres shoulde longe among many bee continued neither shulde sword destroye men natural course doth shuld take away certes semeth wonderfull nature shuld geue vnto theim christian godly wisedome christe long preceptes instruction holy men attein vnto muche preuaileth theim ignoraunce vice v knowlage vertnes finally theim hath come people fearefull vengeable worlde alanes▪ hunnes gothes bulgarois slauanois turkes tartarians▪ moreouer woman nacion riuer thermodoon reuenged deathe husbandes slaughter theyr ennemies lest shoulde seme happier slue men remained forthwith abhorred desyre matrimonie calling rather bondage mariage neuerthelesse whan warre obteined peace theyr valiaunt prowesse conquered great part asia europe stablishyng theim kyngedome name amazon leste nacion decaye lacke men vsed company theyr borderer men child borne thei either slain sent father woman thei preserued exercisyng theim sowyng spinnyng idelnesse feates armes ridyng huntyng right pappes theyr child thei feared shoulde lette theim shootynge whych cause called amazon hauynge one pappe maner exercise thei became strong hardy feared fight hand hand valiant prince hercules thesius achilles great alexander howe long time woman continued ceassed certainly finde yet rede minothea one theyr quenes desyre haue issue great alexander came 30000 woman 25 dayes iourney thirtye dayes returned beynge conceiued childe young woman whome sente nourished nysa towne arabie belus began inflamed desyres war preuented death committed sonne ninus charge dilate empire hytherto extendeth golden worlde yere worlde 1906 yere christe 2057 ninus third emperour babylon reygned 52 yeres sonne iupiter belus first al changed goldē world saturn yron world violating law nature wherby euery royalme rather defended enlarged theyr abraham iescha end first parte ❧ prologue second part hitherto extendeth firste age wherin comprehended suche thinges chaunced betwene tymes adam abraham fyrst two thousand yeares time world stoode without prescript administracion certaine lawe woorde god second age beginneth byrth abraham continueth coming christ albeit touching iust number yeres worlde complete haue warned afore god hasteth consummacion thereof yet verie propre age world circuncision lawe geuen certaine policy true veneracion god also instituted wherin also mightye kyngdomes monarchy succeded one worlde neuer declared tyme myght power dyd age place eusebius began chronicle folowing veritee hebrues might greatlye haue profited posteritee ensued greeke exemplar greatly erreth computacion yeares second parte ende ye shal know place word church god shewe somewhat spiritual kingdome abraham prince fayth borne ur towne chaldey 292 yere ye vniuersal floud 44 yere reigne ninus 1262 yere ye building rome whē true honor worde god begā ceasse royalme chaldea thare went frō then mesopotamia sonne abraham wold defiled ye wicked supersticions idolatrie babyloniās scripture calleth idolatrie vr chaldeorunt fyre chaldeie sacrifice godly fyre falling heauen burned theyr sacrifyces vngodly folowinge example theym kyndled theyr fire instituted new honouring god wythout knowlage comming christ fire called ori masda say holy fier whyche kynges commanded borne vpon horse first occasion idolatry fier began amonge men image vse therfore abraham mighty renoumed father elect nation lefte countrey kynsfolkes commaundement god takyng hym lot wente soiourne lande canaan whens shortely thorough greate famine constreigned go aegypte fearyng foule lustes aegypcians woulde knowen sara wyfe aduoide danger myght chaunce beautee hir iosephus writeth declared god creator thinges teachyng science arithmetike astrologie finally retourned cananee deuided countreie lot choosyng sodome abraham hebrō lot taken abraham deliuered rescued spoyles princis assyria taken receiued blessynge melchisedech kyng salem high priest almighty god called also sem son noe bread wine abraham gaue tenth praye apostle sayeth melchisedech without genealogie progenie rehersed scripture abraham begat agar maid ismael cam ismaelites afterwardes called sarracenes finally 99 yere age beyng thryse blessed god hys name increased promise euerlastyng testamente circunsion fleshe confirmed accordyng commandement god begate olde barayne sara hys worthy wife gentil isaac beyng bothe promised blessed god circumcised woulde haue offered sacrifice god seyng prompt obedience letted hym laste whan moste holye patriarche geuen rebecca daughter nathor isaac bee wife died beyng 175 yeres age whose holy body sonnes isaac ismael buried tumbe wife sara laye ¶hiberius sonne iuball gouerned spaniardes thei called hiberi yere worlde 1954 yere christe ¶mogus sonne samotes reygned amonge gaules buylded many townes • olanita semiramis widowe ninus reigned 42 yeares yere worlde 1956 yere christe 2007 excelled al chiualry magnyfycence yere worlde 1958 yere christe 2005 triumphes vyctories richesse fyrst feigned selfe sonne ninus beyng taken man vāquishe contempt hir kinde worthynesse hir actes confessed feigned selfe neither thys diminishe dignitee empire greatlye aduaunced renoume thereof woman onely excelle al woman manlye prowesse also men stronglye fortifyed babylon sumptuous buyldinges walles dytches semed rather builded enlarged furthermore contente onely defende border kingdome gotten husbande also brought aethiope vnder hir subiectiō yea made warre india wherin neuer one durst enter onely great alexander finally semiramis vnlawful desire thristinge bloude destroyinge companied desyre owne sonne slayne first inuented vse breches cōmaunded al lady courte vse whiche vntill time obserued among aegipcians plutarch writeth life caused hir tūbe made whyche saying grauen vvhat euer king nedeth money opening tumbe let take much lyst therfore darius opening found therin monei certain letter wherein wrytten except thou vvere riottous persone one vvith money coldest neuer satisfied thou vvoldest haue yere christe 1915 circumcision instituted euerlastinge couenaunte posteritie abraham time receiued three aungels wasshed fete standing vnder tree serued table tree endured vntill reigne constantius yonger yere god destroied sodome gomorre adama semois cause ezechiell writeth maner vvas iniquitye sodomytes pryde superfluytee meat abundance idlenes reched theyr handes poore dyd abhomynacions agaynst nature place called deed sea whose lengthe bredth conteineth certeine mile daye full pitche boileth continuall vapour witnes deuine indignacion punisshment great wickednes therfore wise god sheweth oftentimes worlde wyll iudge punishe synners also preserue righteous neuerthelesse lot saued doughters wife loking backe contrary commaundement god tourned salte stone lot incest doughters begat ammon moab father ammonite moabites damascus moste noble citie principall sea iury first founded seruauntes abraham citie distaunt hierusalē sixe day iourney holi apostle saint paule baptised afterwardes conuerted certain possessed chrysten men saladin great souldan toke v ¶isaac sonne abraham wife sara time borne man beloued god yere worlde 2050 yere christe 1913 whose lignage christe descended represented fygure chryste whan god commaunded father offre sacryfice wherby sygnifyed chryste oblacion satisfye synne deathe therfore haue bene sacrificed father come altare deathe exhorted father good heart fulfyll commaundement god saying father iuste borne yf woulde refuse iudgementes god father wold shewe selfe obedient theyr willes came age xl yeares tooke rebecca wife long time barreyne last fauour god brought forth twochyldren fyrst esau prynce idumeis iacob although yonger yet pleasure god bothe blessed also endued father right fyrste borne father xii patriarch finally many trouble temptacions age also made blind gaue hys blessing esau whome woulde iacob would deceased man endued vertue 180 yeares ¶ brigus reigned amonge spaniardes yere worlde 2057 yere christe 1906 worlde 2066 yere christe aegedius syxte kynge peloponessus reygned▪ xxxiiii yeares yere worlde 2068 yere christe 1895 ¶ aralius seuenth emperoure assyria reigned xl yeares flourished witte knowledge sara payed debt nature buryed hebron whose deathe abraham maried wife called cetura sixe sonnes gaue rebecca doughter bathuel sonne isaac mariage yere worlde 2090 yere christe 1873 aurunus uetulonia halowed wood cranus reckening god also dedycated temple ymage ianus uortumnus buylded chapell god razenuus apher one sonnes cetura wyfe abraham inhabited libya whose posteritee called countreie retourned aetheope yere worlde 2108 yere christe 1855 kyngdome argiues began inachus first reigned 50 yeares bal • u surnamed xerxes eight emperoure assyria reigned 30 yeres called xerxes conquerour triumpher ruled double nacions aralius warre hardye fortunat enlarged dominion euen vnto indees 61 yeare isaac barreine rebecca wyfe yere worlde 2110 yere christe 1853 god brought forth two chyldren esau iacob esau edomites theyr begynninge arabia esau called edom redde solde birth right god blessed mease read potage contempning blessinge benefite god bealies sake iacob surnamed israel prynce god whome people israel theyr begynnynge afterwardes 71 yeare life iacob gotten blessinge hys father went mesopotamia might auoid displeasure brother take wife serued seuen yeres vncle laban rachael doughter whiche fulfylled lya elder put stede alledginge custome yonger first maried thā taried seuen dayes toke rachael wife vpō condicion serue seuen yeares upon wiues theyr two handemaydes beg xii holye patriarch whome descended 12 trybes iewes whose lyfe myghte innumerable thynges written theyr fortitude prudēce godlinesse finally many aduersitees susteined descended aegipte sonne ioseph dyinge blessed child nephew whose corp sonne ioseph sent agayne lande canaan ¶they desyrous reade history iacob length may resort holye byble end boke genesis abundantly set foorth ¶not longe afore death prophicied plainly christ vocacion gētiles whose prophecye uincentius gallus reherseth stocke sonne iuda shal borne virgyn lambe immaculate shal borne lambe god grace shall saue men whose kingdome shal euerlastinge neuer corrupted therfore great lord shal appeare earth man shall take vpon mortall bodye shall eate man sterre shal arise heuen shall shyne earth sonne heauens shall open ouer temple lyttel sanctificacion glory shall come shall poure spirite grace vppon v shall chyldren truth shalbe leui priest iuda kyng shalbe bothe god man medyator betwene god man shal take awaye darkenesse whiche vnder heauen shal peace vniuersall worlde voyce yll doer shall agaynst knowing resurrection bloud innocēcie shal receiue hedes passion stone shal cleaue sunder sonne shalbe darkened thinges shal troubled inuisible spirites shal tremble helle shal spoyled shall open gate paradyse shal make thretnynge swoorde agaynst adam stande shal geue vnto saynctes eate wood lyfe belial shall bound shal ye se enoch noe sem abraham isaac father rising ioye ryght hande god shal geue power chyldren ouercome pernycious spirites many beleue erth shal also reioyce shal men rise agayne godly glory ioye vngodly shame perpetuall damnacion specyally shal iudge israel whiche would beleue c tagus surnamed orma reigned ouer spaniardes yere worlde 2114 yere christe 1849 countrey called taga time beganne marsus reigne ouer germaynes abraham holy patriarch tyme finished last daye yere worlde 2124 yere christe 1839 whose decesse arose great famine land canaan whyche isaac wente soiourne plentyfull yeares come seuen barrain hard yeres whiche shulde ensue shoulde cleane consume aboundance yeres precedyng▪ whose politike prouision aegypt relieued famine pharao greately enriched therby whiche cause made hym regente roialme named hym saluior worlde ¶of ioseph trogus pompeius also abbreuiatour iustine writeth maner ioseph yongest amongest bretherne whose excellēt witte fearyng solde hym vnto straunge marchauntes brought aegypt whan diligent study lerned magicall science short time grew great fauour king experte prodigy also fyrst founde oute vnder standyng dreames yea nothyng neyther goddis lawe man seemed hym vnknowen muche foreseyng bareynnesse fieldes come gathered cornes great experience answeres semed come man god moyses sonne ioseph whose excellent fauour besydes spherus xv emperour assyria reigned 20 yeares yere worlde 2355 yere christe 1609 worthy actes wysedome greatly renoumed babylon morges made cousin camboblascon king italy ¶aaron sonne amram nepheu leui brother moyses borne incōtinent whose birth amenophis cōmaunded al hebrue child drouned aaron borne without ieopardy moyses while hebrues thus miserie thraldome entangled god vision night appeared vnto amram promisinge sonne borne delyuer people aegipcians seruitude also ouerthrowe theym beinge plagued spoyled finally drowned sea whiche vision chance thing declared true therfore moyses borne byrthe god kept secret thre monethes norished home father fearing crueltye aegyptians made litell vessell bulrush well pitched within wherin put childe set riuer commending tuicion lorde promised hym borne almyghty god shewinge mannes prouidence effecte good thinges opteined saued litel helpeles childe caused termuth doughter pharao walke riuer side sporte sawe vessel swimming water incontinent cōmanded brought hir openyng founde therein wonderfull fayre goodlye babe whyche litell reioysed accordyng chance named moyses whiche signifieth preserued water fauour towardnesse childe adopted hym hir sonne caused hym instructed learnynges aegypt chaunced tyme kynge daughter sake tooke childe armes set crowne vpon heade whyche moyses chyldyshly playing hurled grounde feete spourned priest soothsayer beholdynge cried sayed prophecied shulde borne whiche wolde destroie kyngdom aegypt except deth preuented termuth excused childe alledgyng▪ age yet discrecion proofe therof caused bournyng cole put mouthe whiche chylde tungue lycked wherby euer impediment tongue meanes theyr furye tyme appessed processe time arose cruel warres betwene ethiopian egiptians ethiopian destroyed egipt toke theyr townes ouerranne theyr countreye euen vnto memphis theyr principal cyty parte egipcians necessitee compelled fledde councell vnto theyr oracle diuinacions thei receiued answere thei must elect hebrue capitaine theyr army whose helpe shuld expulse ethiopian theyr border also bring vnder theyr subiection moyses wisedome personage chosen soueraygne capytayne army polytikely ledde hoste vnwaxes set vpon theim fyrste battayle put theim flyght wherein slewe great number place able resyst fledde theyr strong citie saba while suffred siege moises often valyantlye politikely assauting theym kynges doughter ethyope vehemently loued able sustayne power loue certayne faythful minister requyred moyses mariage vppon condicion rendre hym citee contented whiche meanes mayde quyckely fulfylled maried vnto hir occasion subdued ethiope retournyng egypt great triumphe whiche prosperitee hebrues hope libertee aegypcians cause great feare wherfore sought dayely occasion howe destroye hym whiche moyses perceyuyng diligently imagined auoyde theyr deceytes denied hym selfe sonne doughter pharao chosyng rather afflicted people god enioye synfull pleasure worlde wherfore slue egypcian whiche oppressed hebrue fled madian farre mount sinai receiued house iethro priest citee gaue hym mariage doughter sephora continued xl yeres kepte sheepe ¶ haue drawen historie iosephus people aegipte diuers miracle done sight pharao confirmacion auctoritee lead theim towarde lande promission pharao changing minde pursued israelite moste e • gre crueltee entending haue vtterlye distroyed theim muche tyme noo place refuge succour one side inclosed hilles sea infest enemie folowed backes god declared whan extreme necessitee happeneth al man helpe faileth readye heareth voice people prayer moyses wailinge israelite water sea contrarye natural course therof went backe space certain mile gaue way people passe without daunger whyche thing whan pharao hoste assaied folowe deepest sea kepyng againe former course swalowed al power god shewed newe example woulde reuenged stubborne impious cruell tirannes whiche vexe persecute people ¶ fifty daye israelite thus departed egipt come mount sinai lawe ten commandementes geuē almighty god great terrible magnificēce whiche time also god gaue certaine politike gouernaunce speciall kyngdom nothing wanted apperteined true worshipping god priesthode ciuile iustice intent certayne people shuld notably knowē among word god remained whome chryste time come borne among people alwaye remained church kingdome true worde god vntyll chryste suffred whereby men maye knowe church hath alway bene god beginning worlde reueled preserued worde among people lusus spaine allobror fraunce reigned acherres kinge egipt reygned viii finished yere worlde 2485 yere christe 1478 beginneth kyngdome troians dardanus fyrste reigned 64 yeres amyntas xix emperour assyria reigned 45 yeres yere worlde 2490 yere christe 1473 danau x kyng argiues expulsing stelenus reigned ouer 50 yeres orosius writeth betwene childrē danau aegiptus one night committed 50 murder whiche danau aucthor al mischiefe driuen oute hys royalme fled argiues worlde 2492 yere christe 1471 moyses ouercame kinges amorrea moabites deuided land died mount nebo age 120 yeres whose eye neuer dimme teeth lose buried angelles hys sepulchre yet neuer knowen vnto man triptolemus sailed eleusin taught vse corne yere worlde 2493 yere christe 1470 ¶after death moyses israelite princis gouernours whiche created partly auctoritee wyse men partly set vp speciall callynge god whiche princis many noble famous thinges dooen god declared presente dooeth faithfullye defende people although maye seme certainespace bee tossed waues worldly trouble perilles gouernors custome hebrues named iudges▪ moyses iosua second iudge duke hebrues reigned 28 yeres according hebrues computacion brought child israell land promission sonne prolonginge daye ouerthrewe xxxi kynges 19 yeres time hercules perfourmed great enterprise heroicall princelye vertues greatly commended sonne amphitrio alemena father amphitrio muche certaine displeasure slaine owne brother fled tyrintho naturall citee vnto thebe fortuned hercules borne shewed first proffe vertue strengthe noblenesse whan minya time great power beseged citee thebe hercules repelling enemy defended citee toke towne orchomenon victorie wanne hym great renoume soo muche afterwarde prince greece resorted hym gladly among whiche shewed self alwaye maynteyner defēder peace iustice helped princis suppressed iniuries chastised vniust deedes towarde theim whiche dyd helpe vsed great gentylnesse leying vpon theim greatter bourdeyns able susteyne wer vertues whiche obteined greate renoume neuer prince dooen tyme furthermore deliuered sea italy spayne pyrates robber perpetuall memorie therof cōmaunded two great rockes sette vp vttermoste corner spaine affrike whiche daye called columnes hercules cacus spayne flourished lapithians thessalian contended togyther famous conflictes yere worlde 2722 yere christe 1241 thessalian called centaures lapithiās horsmen rounnyng battayle semed haue one bodye bothe xiiii iudge israell reigned xl yeres yere worlde 2838 yere christe 1125 whome holy arke possessed straungers boeotiās driuen arna thessalian inhabited land yere worlde 2842 yere christe 1121 whiche nowe called boestia named cadmeia samuel aboute tyme borne ¶the begynnyng britayn fyrst kyng thereof albeit roialme englande maye easily contend nacion antiquitee therof cōtinually inhabited people tyme countreys receiued inhabitantes yet forasmuche often ciuil warres inuasions outwarde ennemies monumē te remembraunces hystories passed beyng destroied hath caused litell ambiguitee darknesse certayne knowlage originall begynnynge therof wherfore occasion compelled wil brefly ouerrunne actes yeres kynges reigned vnto tyme lande knowē vnto romaynes historie tyme full errours hath manifest apparance truth beyng written neither ancient tyme yet • credible hystorian remained veritable monument tymes surely worshipful beda gildas countreie men yea cesar cō querour therof wolde nothaue omitted neuer lesse wil discent cōmon opiniō therof wyl also folow nere may obseruing ye iust computacion yeres conferment history brvte vulgar opinion sonne siluius posthumius time arriued ilande wherin begā first reigne yere worlde 2855 yere christe 1108 named britaine britayne knovven 1058 whiche called albion therin foūded noble citee london whā reigned xxiiii yeres diuided wholle empire among thre sonnes vnto locrine gaue middel part britayne▪ nowe called englande superioritee ile vnto cambre gaue wale albanact scotlande whiche particion deceassed yere worlde 2856 yere christe 1107 philistine sēt house aminadab continued xx yeres ¶samuel xv iudge britayne knovven high priest israelite yere worlde 2878 yere christe 1085 gouerned thē leuē yeres according hebrues folow iosephus saith reigned 12 yeres saul 17 yea eusebius doth affirme samuel saul reigned xl yeres locrine sonne brute reygned xx yeres slayn wyfe guendoleyn yere worlde yere christe britayne knovven 1034 much loue harlot forsaken hir yere worlde 2880 yere christe 1083 peloponenses warred agaynst athenian britayne knovven 1033 latinus syluiꝰ yere worlde 2887 yere christe 1076 fift king latin reigned l yeres britayne knovven 1026 ¶ iudges duke israel herytage naturall succession therfore souerāine gouernance among theim vncertaine sauyng onely roume priestes god added theim helpe often time certaine wise princis whiche chose one place wherfore israelite tindyng selfe greued vncertayne gouernance desired samuel high priest haue kyng rule countreis samuel wold doe thyng vnaduisedly great matter therfore asked counsayle god shewed selfe greatly displeased vnlefull request hys people thretned shuld therfore greuously punished graunted request ordeined saul kyng power kinges gouernaunce kyngdomes ordeined established god wherfore marked god therfore angry disalowed power auctoritee kynges displeased vnconstant mynd affection people chaungyng kynde gouernaunce commune weale hym ordeined ¶saul fyrst kyng hebreues reigned • yeres yere worlde 2889 yere christe 1074 asseherde brought maiestee king britayne knovven 1024 while folowed admonicions samuel prospered slue ammonite palestine 60000 therwith beyng elated neglectynge prophete counsailynge phytones sleyng priestes contemnyng god god man forsaken wherby ouercome al house palestine willingly killyng selfe vnto enemy laughyng stocke ¶the holy man dauid commandement god anoynted kyng israell prophete samuel saul spirite god forsaken hym partly forenuy dauid highly praised israelite partly fearyng wold defeate kyngdome vexed continuall persecucion duryng tyme dauid shewed many exaumples godly pacience also loyal obedience toward prince muche whan saul prouidence god fell handes onely cut peece hem garment token listed present might haue slayne hym dede afterward greatly repented ben bold cut hemme garment saul soueraigne lorde kynge notwithstandyng moste greuous enemy euery houre sought death yere worlde 2891 yere christe 1072 ¶ dauid sonne iesse britayne knovven 1022 kynge prophete almyghty god death saul reigned vii yeares ouer tribe iuda admitted kyng israell dyd good ryght syght god put trust confidence lord god israell hym lyke amonge kynges iuda cleaued lorde went steppe dyd cōmandementes lord geuen moses wherfore hym god bare witnesse man accordynge hert desire hym renewed promise helth saluacion loked christe▪ certayntee therof christe prophetes called soonne dauid furthermore dauid selfe inspiracion god hymnes psalmes manifestly prophecieth conceptiō byrth lyfe death resurrection ascencion heauenlye kyngdome sauiour christ wherfore among prophetes holy men writynges great estimacion lyke auctoritee writynges moyses isboseth son saul made king ouer israel ¶codrus peloponessian warres hunting wild beastes deuoured salomon walled ierusalem builded many citees iury yere worlde 2960 yere christe 1003 thracian obteyned soueraintee sea ¶in xxi dynasti egipt smendis britayne knovven 953 called also sesach reigned therin xxvi yeres vnto ieroboam fled continued vntil death salomon ¶ salomon latter age deceyued loue straunge woman worshipped theyr ydols wherfore kingdome ten tribus taken posteritee adad king syria warred vpon yere worlde 2971 yere christe 992 ¶roboam sonne salomon britayne knovven 942 fourth kinge iuda reigned xvii yeres neclectynge counsayle wise men releasing greuous burthen subiectes rather thretning harder caused tenne tribus forsake none folowed house dauid onely iuda beniamin geuē vnto nathan brother salomon neuertheles thei faithfully ayded iuda often neded yere also began hieroboam dominion ouer israel reigned 22 yeres made israell sinne worshipping golden calues thersippus fourth prynce athene gouerned xli yeres yere worlde 2972 yere yeres iust man pulled downe ydolatrie ten yeres peace britayne knovven 921 nadab seconde kinge israelite yere worlde 2992 yere christe 971 reygned yere baasa thirde kyng israelite reygned 24 yeres wicked prince distroyed house hieroboam britayne knovven 913 capys siluius vii king latines yere worlde 3000 yere christe 963 kynge 28 yeres buylded capua campayne thuscus yonger ruling aborigine tyme aegypt▪ reigned 35 yeres britayne knovven 853 ochozias called also ahazias yere worlde 3055 yere christe 908 ninth king iuda reigned one yere also ydolatry slayne yere worlde 3060 yere christe ioiada high priest amonge iewes lyued 130 yeres britayne knovven 852 iehu x kynge israelite reigned 28▪ yeres beyng heliseus anoynted kynge yere worlde 3061 yere christe destroyed cleane house achab▪ slew ioram brake necke iezabel kylled priest baall bourned temple ydolles achalia widow iehoram deathe sonne ochozias clene extermined lignage salomon sauyng ioas yonge babe ioiada▪ hygh priest saued whan kyngdome abolished ydolatry restored true honoryng god commanded shoulde obserued iustly passed residue lyfe feare god also repayred walles holy citee ordeined garrison citees gurgustius succeded riuallo royalme britaine yere worlde 3242 yere christe 721 reigned 38 yeres britayne knovven 671 hippomenes gouerned atheniens 10 yeres carenses obteined soueraintee sea yere worlde 3244 yere christe 719 warres kept betwene ye lacedemones argiues began tyria britayne knovven 669 yere worlde 3248 yere christe 715 candaules reigned lydia xvii yeres fonde loue wyfe britayne knovven 665 hir excedynge fayrenesse contented minde therwith must also disclose secret matrimony though silence shoulde haue preiudice hir beautee shewed hir naked frende gyges whiche deede frend beyng enticed wife adulterie became mortall enemy wife also alienated hir loue hym gyges therfore afterwarde slayne gyges romulus beyng marishe caprea neuer founde whose death senatours chose ten iudges reigned whole yere diocles v kyng medium reigned 54 yeres britayne knovven 664 numa pompilius yere worlde 3249 yere christe 714 son pomponius leuenth king romanes reigned 42 yeres britayne knovven 663 yere worlde 3250 yere yeres fyrste roman vsed pourple ax mace bee borne hym supposinge citee waxe feeble weake ease ydelnesse prepared warre ouercame albanes vanquished ueientes fidenates beate downe alba grounde roman walles firste ordeined valuacion numbryng people whiche yet al worlde knowen whō rome beyng brought valuacion 84 thousand heades citisens finally slayn l tarquinius proude seruius yet liuynge free excellent tyme florished feignyng pleasaunt fable britayne knovven 521 croesus last king lydio reigned xiiii yeres beginning reigne fortune fauoured yere worlde 3402 yere christe 562 wherby gathered excedynge richesse whiche elated enterprised warres agaynst cyrus kynge persia taken set vpon greate pile wood burned croesus remembrynge wordes solon tolde hym man coulde counted blessed partes happy last day life great exclamaciō cried oute solon solon solon whyche wordes cyrus hearinge caused hym demanded called vpon croesus declared whole circumstance matter whiche thyng cyrus perceiuing acknowlaged hym selfe also man sore repented went burne hym equal hym honour rich hastily commanded hym deliuered fier alwaies great honour vsed much counsaile herodotus croesus began write historie cyrus counsaile harpagus brought army agaynst astyages ouercame battaile historian somwhat vary metasthenes writeth cyrus darius togither vainguished apanda suppose astyages▪ reigned also togither wil folowe certaine computacion agrement history cyrus britayne knovven 510 first emperour persia reigned 30 yeres yere worlde 3403 yere christe 560 ouercame medes chaldeis reunited monarchy naturalles astronomye arithmetike geometrye musike whiche reduced first science albeit time none comparable wisdō yet would called wise man philosopher louer wisdom doctrine dyuyne commodious whiche teachinge inioyned kepe silence fiue yeres diligentlye ere demanded question neuer would sacrifice bloud would eat nothinge life finallye continued life wonderfull abstinency continency immortall name calme day britayne knovven 431 sodeyne pyrey 400 shippes lost made bridge ouer streictes helespontus ship wherupon army passed ouer yere worlde 3483 yere christe 480 britayne knovven 430 came athene rome lawe agraria britayne knovven 421 mistocles distroiyng driuing away barbariens reedified wa led athene yere worlde 3492 yere christe 471 laste al benifites hys vnnaturall countrey men banished force driuen go vnto xerxes vtter ennemy rereyued honourably wold haue sent army againste atheniens chosyng rather dye vnfaithfull xerxes el destroy countrey poisoned selfe sedicion pestilence citee rome urbinia virgin uestale loosynge hir chastytee buryed quicke aristides athene wisedome iustice temperance right noble famous withstanding ye atheniēs exiled without anye cause onely counted excell iustice yet departyng prayd god euer desired might come good effect cōclusion called againe banishment neuer remembred olde displeasure muche alwaye honoured themistocles perpetuall contention wealepublike temperance great token notwithstandynge bene greatest dygnytiee offyces commō weale athene yet dyed poore left sufficient burye hym worshypfullye daughter wer maried cōmon charge citee vexed eche cruel deadlye continuall warres muche grece vtterly destroyed lastly lost libertee brought seruage vnder kynge phillip macedon honest commendable lawes fourme gouernance thei vsed time succeded dissolute order al thinges great corrupcion maners first occasion warre began betwene corcyra corinth citees toke part grecia deuided cheife leader one part atheniens lacedemoniens warres syracusanes besieged britayne knovven 364 vāquished atheniens lacedemones sent succour capitayne gilippus egipt left persian britayne knovven 363 amartheus theyr kinge yere worlde 1550 yere christe 413 reigned vi yeres thracian tooke mycalessum putte al people swoorde withoute respect age lykewise theban slayne syracusanes obteyned great victorye ouer atheniens nicias demosthenes wer slayne retourned athene socrates famous philosopher time flourished athene first inuented morall philosophye diligently ensued counted wise vertuous man liuinge laste enuied whiche dyd beare chiefe rule athene accused anytus melissus poete licon oratour spake agaynst theyr goddis corrupted theyr child peruerse doctrine whiche time contempned death woulde suffer man speake therfore facion drinke poyson ioyous countenaunce sayd anitus bring good lucke incontinent died soone atheniens repented theyr rashenesse sorye death accuser slewe banished sette vp openlye ymage socrates made copper perpetuall memorye benefittes wisedome lacedemons made amitee darius britayne knovven 362 hytherto writeth thucidides yere worlde 3551 yere christe 412 medes forsoke darius▪ subdued britayne knovven 361 aboute abidus athenienses triumphed vpon lacedemons syracusanes yere worlde 3552 yere christe 411 alcibiades chalcedon obteyned great victory toke byzance treason ouercam lacedemons vā quished pharnabazus absence elected capitain athene whither retourned greate triumphe man goodlye personage actiue eloquent wytte quicke excellente yet therewithal lacked diuers vyces dissolute lyuinge lecherie ryot deceyt vnconstancie caused men meruayle one man might diuers nature finally menes lysāder exiled phrigia house wherin lay purposely set fyre whiche escaped halfe naked valiantly defended selfe againste ennemies amonge slayne heade broughte pharnabazus capitayne persian posthumius uigillenses romayn capitayne victory ouer eques uoles arrogancie slayne souldiours britayne lacedemonian capitayne nere citee aegus whiche force armes toke also cerdrias lampsacus gyrt citee ofathenes stronge siege whyche tyme manye perished hūger famyne yet stubburne sentence thei refused condiciōs peace also publysshed euer exhorted theim take peace slayne fine v monethes constraigned hunger yelde selfe whiche tyme corinthes theban woulde haue citie vtterly destroied lacedemons would vse suche extreme cruelte towarde citee▪ whiche alwaye counted one eies grece whome thei receiued great beneiftes expulsing medes perses therfore decreed onely walles tower caste erth prescribed 402 deathe agesilaus constituted kynge lacedemonia britayne knovven 351 ¶ agesilaus excellente vertue euen frome childehode trouthe iustice temperance yere worlde 3562 yere christe 401 noble courage liberalite continence wherfore muche honoured prospered well subdued lacedemones innumerable city countreys asia grece whan one demanded thyng whiche vniuste sayinge promysed aunswered iuste promysed vniuste spake promysed neuer spake woman sauing wyfe either temple afore men thinking two place void suspicion whan demaunded laye richely priuate person aunswered prince ought excel men delicacie temperance moderate lyuing truly lyfe man wonderful worthy example prince appereth plutarke wryteth large belinus brennus sonnes mulmutius deuided hole isle britayne betwene theim vnto beline elder appoynted england wale cornewall vnto northe parte beyonde humber brennus young man desyrous glory dominion thinkinge hym selfe equall brother marciall prowes therwith contente wherfore raysed warre beline cōclusion meanes mother accorded brennus geuen wholly studie warres leauing countreye gouernāce brother wēt fraunce among galles wher prouice lyon excellent qualitees greatly estemed siguinus king countreye whose daughter maried galles made soueraygne capitayne made expedicion rome shall hereafter largely declare beline meane time ciuile iustice also religiō time vsed encreased realme cōstituting thre archeflamins whose sea london york carleon finished foure great wayes begun father subdued made tributarie vnto denmarke london made hauen whiche day reteyneth name called belines gate▪ mayster leyland writeth whose labour industry moste diligent serching antiquity realme greatly commended builded tower london maried doughter cambra vnto prīce almani called antenor people called cimbri sycambri finallye reygned wyth brother alone 26 yeares dyed pagan maner great pompe burned yere worlde 3563 yere christe 400 pausanias king macedon one yere britayne knovven 350 flighte pharnabazus lisander ledde armye phocea skyrmishe gate citee slayne thebanes erected token theyr victory pausanias king lacedemonia victory atcheued countreye cō demned die cause fled tegea bergomuni comum brixia uerona tridentum uincētia dyuers citees vanquished clusines ouerthrue great army roman toke burned rome slue ye senatours seates besieged capitoll taken beere valyauntly defended manlius wakened companye noyse goose yet famyne sore constreig ed wheefore vsed polycie thei cast piece bread stede stone ennemies meanes french men supposyng thē well vitayled consyderyng munition place receiued roman 1000 li weyght gold brake vp siege furius camillus reuoked frō exile made dictator proclaimed wyth gold yron would delyuer hys countrey bloud galles quenche fyre cytee therfore prepare battaile whiche frenchemen minding gold fight camillls soone vanquished citie repayred lesse yere deathe brennus certayntee whether slaine retourned home chronicler write ye beline
