deceites subiectes slayne britayne knovven 332 mantius moued sedicion rome againste cemyllus noble whiche cause condemned yere worlde 3581 yere christe 382 caste headlong rocke tarpeius dionisius yonger tiran sicily began reygne britayne knovven 330 place xenophon writethe actes yere worlde 3583 yere christe 380 grecian mausolus king caria reigned whose wife artemisia buylded wonderful sepulchre whiche taken one goodly woorkes world yere worlde 3586 yere christe 377 britayne knovven 327 goodlye monumentes dead men called mausoleum athenian time prince grecia isocrates famous oratour time flourished whose schole proceded moste excellent oratours grece xenophon philosophier athene disciple socrates folower plato time renoumed excellent capitayne brought army extreme partes babilō home theyr owne coūtrei safegard delectable stile writing named muse athene made excellent warkes marciall feates huntinge keping horse liued 89 yeres plato prince philosophiers wisedom knowlage vertue eloquence farre excedinge al gentile borne athene lyinge cradell bee founden bringe honye mouthe wythout hurtinge childe whiche diuinours interpretate shoulde flowe eloquence moste swete dilectable first lerned letter dion grā marian exercised youth wrastling feates actiuitie name firste aristocles big brode stature bodye surnamed plato vntyll xx yeares olde gaue selfe make amorous verse whiche came socrates bourned atteintiuely folowed socrates longe liued onely famous philosophiers geometriciās grecia also wente italye affrike egipte learne misticall science sayled thrise sicilie escaping daunger death solde bondman deuided philosophie three partes morall naturall racionical athene chase place called achademia wherī taught wherof disciple called achademici nowe place learninge exersised called achademia furthermore called diuinus plato excellēt doctrine whiche conteineth many thinges sainct augustine sayeth doth accorde holy scripture much therin perceiued first part genesis vnto spiritus domini ferabitui super aqua gospel iohn vnto et tenebre cum non comprehenderunt mistery thre person diuinitee therein expressed died writinge beynge age lxxxi yeres iudas high priest slue brother iesu temple hierusalem gurguintus sonne beline yere worlde 3588 yere christe 375 succeded father reigned realme xix yeares britayne knovven subdued denmarke compelling continue tribute retourne home met fleete spaniardes whiche sekinge habitacions theyr countrey populus able susteine king granted isle irelande inhabite holde theyr soueraygne lorde socrates write spaniardes arriued time irelande haue declared britayne knovven 324 amintas kinge macedon vanquished illyrian forced pay theyr charge yere worlde 3589 yere christe 274 lay philip hostage sent thebe cōmitted custodie epaminondas instructed maner discipline roman fought prousperously uolsciās latines antiates submitted thē romās alexander king macedon one yere britayne knovven 323 yere worlde 3590 yere christe 373 ¶the citee rome v yeres without magistrate meanes great discord variance meued promulgation certaine lawes desired firste one consulles shoulde chosen among common nexte dettes diminished thirdely none noble shoulde possesse ouer certayne stinte landes whiche lawes noble men would wise suffre take effect therfore tribune liciuius sexius whiche deuysed lawes letted forbad magistrate chosen space v yeare constreigned externall warre tyme breake vp contention shortly renewed ¶epammondas thebane borne sundrye qualitees bothe body mynde renoumed al kyndes musike perfectly instructed daunced therwith excedyngly well vertue hym lacking oftentymes refused great summes money riche presentes sent prince although pore sayinge thyng honest whiche required woulde bycause good without rewarde yf yll honest goodes worlde shuld make hym profitable vnto countrey bounden redy freely yf otherwise ryches mought counteruaile loue bare commune weale bataile ouercame athenian lacedemones one daye victorie al grece finally conflycte mantinea betwene thebanes lacedemones woūded vnto deth longe spere head remayning still body yet retayned lyfe vntyll hoste victory sayde haue lyued long enoughe dye vnuanquished poore buried charge citee yere worlde 3591 yere christe 372 ¶ ptolomeus alorites craftely depriued alexander realme lyfe reigned 4 yeres britayne knovven 322 yere knovven 319 yere worlde 3595 yere christe 368 perdicasiew ptolomeus britayne knovven 318 reigned macedone viii yeres agesilaus king lacedemonia returne egipt sodain tempest beyng driuen vpon coost libya dyed whan 84 yeres age ¶aristotle renoumed philosopher sonne nichomachus phisicion borne stagera grece consumed youth ryotrouslie afterwarde scholar noble plato xx yeres continually excelled al men sharpenesse witte knowlage diuerssciences wherfore king philip macedony sente sonne alexander taughte sayinge thanked god sonne borne time man began sect folowers wherof called peripatetici taught deathe plato xxiii yeres banished athene supposed deemed well theyr goddes wrytten died occasion went sea side perceyued fisherman sittinge doinge somwhat asked tolde riddle longe study coulde assoyle incontinente earthe closed place called curtius lake l manlius accused pompeius tribune banishinge owne naturall sonne manlius withoute gilte trespasse therefore likely condemned▪ yonge man selfe triumphed ouer put capitain pontius death pyrrhus vainquished pantauchus yere worlde 3673 yere christe 290 britayne knovven 240 pyrrhus kyng epyre valiāt fierse warriour sterne countinaūce terrible behold semed framed nature martiall prowesse doubtfull aunswere apollo enduced ayde tarentines againste romaine ouerthrue ii great batailes losse owne capitaines frendes souldiours saide ouercome romaine one againe shalbe vtterly vndone wherfore marueilynge māhode vertue romains sayde lowd voice frendes oh howe easie subdue thehole world either self aide romaine souldiours romaine theyr kinge prowes wisdome yong scipio persuaded defence countrey whan feared capitaines daungerous warres tooke vpon deliuer italy power anniball beinge 22 yeres age cause fyrst sent spayne army scipio wonderful towardnesse euen frō childhode beyng xvii yeres olde greate battayle pauia lumbardy rescued hys father whan enuyronned ennemies daunger slayne prosperousely finisshed warres taken hand greatly renoumed men came countreys onely see honour famous marcial prowesse excellently well learned fauoured learned men excedingly much refused ambassadours carthage makynge entreatee peace vntyll thei depriued kyngedome exiled royalme antiochus toke hierusalem spoyled temple forced iewes forsake theyr lawes defiled temple ydol also ouercame ptolome pelusium besieged alexandria eleazar iew 90 yeres age slain would contrary lawes eate swine fleshe time seuen yong men mother put terrible death wold offend lawe matathias fine sonnes defended cause iewes slue apollonius perseus toke many city illyria martius consul prosperously entred macedō army matathias died othe bound sonnes preferre lawes wealthe countreys lyues britayne knovven 117 yere worlde 3796 yere christe 168 iudas machabeus gouerned iewes xii yeres shorte tyme delyuered enemy restored lawes sacrifice againe obteined amite roman wherby ye iewes preserued libertee defence countrey praiyng fighting slue 35000 ennemyes nicanor capitain demetrius whose head set vpon castell ierusalem thretnyng hāde hanged temple blasphemous tonge gaue vnto byrdes deuoured finally many batails prosperously fought slaine bacchides capitaine demetrius c popilius c decimius ambassadours romaine restored egypte vnto ptolome antiochus commaundement returned roialme l anicius subdued illyria gentius kinge therof submitted romaine aemilius paulus consulle vanquished perseus conquered al maccdone c • octauius arriued samothracia whither perseus fled destitute succour yelded selfe yere worlde 3797 yere christe 166 endeth kingdome macedones britayne knovven 116 mooste pompous royall triumph aemilius shewed rome yere worlde 3795 yere christe 165 iudas purified temple idol britayne knovven 115 dedicated temple vnto lorde prusias king bithinia commended son nicomedes tuition romains marcellus subdued galles mountaines sulpitius ligurians antiochus hearinge prosperous successe iewes fury purposed destroye theym god beholder thinges strake suche incurable disease wourmes issued body whiche putrified fleshe sauour thereof man might abide miserably died yere christe 163 coilus succeded catellus realme britain quietly ioyning battail alexander slain britayne knovven 100 alexander called also bala • xi kinge syria yere christe 150 reygned v yeres yere worlde 3813 maried doughter ptolome kinge egipt warre beganne betwene carthaginenses masimi • sa king numidia scipio called aphricanus owne good wil toke vpon warres spain fought prosperously agaynst corn nasica prohibited buylding theater thing vnprofitable hurteful good maners britayne knovven 99 yere worlde 3814 yere christe 149 ionathas vanquished appolonius surnamed titus toke azotum britayne knovven 98 subdued ascalon yere worlde 3815 yere christe 148 great victorye retourned ierusalem ptolomeus treasō wrought forsoke alyaunce alexander gaue doughter cleopatra vnto demetrius▪ third warres carthage began chose two asdruballes capitaines footman phan • capitaine theyr horseman cato persuaded roman vtterlye destroy carthage consydering sayd romaine degenerate lytell lytel prowes vertue theyr auncestours wherfore mighty cytie shuld persist state knowinge ignauy nicitee sluggishenesse romaynes nothinge certayne would againe contende empyre oppresse roman subduing vnder theyr power scipio nasica contrary opinion wold haue carthage charge destroied first vnhonest thing romains shewe great tyranny cruelly slea people moreouer vnprofitable without towne aphrica cold kept due obedience excepte woulde tourne wildernesse thyrdelye veray necessary romains haue citye aduersary vnto whereby theyr people mighte incited prowesse actiuitie otherwise shoulde chaunce shoulde contend togither ciuile warres brode enemy yere christe 147 whome shoulde feare britayne knovven 97 conclusion cato obteyned yere worlde 3716 piso sent besiege carthage phan • certaine men fell vnto parte romaine masimissa dying committed sonne custody scipio ad •• scus man bace state britayne knovven 96 whiche counterfayted selfe philip yere worlde 3817 yere christe 146 inuaded macedony ouercam put flight iuuencus pretor scipio besieged carthage asian chose ptolomeus theyr kinge gaue vnto demetrius demetrius called also nicanor xii kinge syria reigned v yeres scipio continuall assault six dayes britayne knovven 95 tooke carthage yere worlde 3818 yere christe 149 vnto hasdrubal yelded selfe albeit scipio permitted free flighte yet spoyle city committed great slaughter commaundemente scipio citee fyred wife hasdrubal stoute courage lept fire finishing life deathe whyche first quene suffered citee burned cōtinually 17 day shewing miserable spectacle beholder sayde carthage thus destroied scipio wente beholde place time fayre beautifull citie stode seinge myserable ruine desolacion therof muche wepinge sayd forsee rome time come lye suche maner ouerthrowen distroyed destruction citie done 679 yeres buylding therof 608 yeres buylding rome 693 yeres arriual brute britayne yere corinte noble citee grece destroyed fyre mummius consul metellus first streictes thermop • le phoea ouercame macedones brought andariscu • subiection recouered macedony mummius toke corinth destroyed fyre wherof came metalles corinth time three notable triumphes atrome scipia triumphed ouer aphrica whose chariot hasdruball led metellus ouer macedonye wente andariscus conterfeite philip mummius ouer corinth borne metalles fayre table corinth time thorough warres dissencion iues arose among sundrye sectes opiniōs theyr religion iii sort first called pharisei segregate chosen vsed certayne constitucions men beside lawe moyses whiche segregate frome residue people reputed theim selfes better obserued feigned fastes prayed commonly stretes might sene called maisters learning better thē others taught immortalitie lyfe god would punishe sinne bel • ued also messias come saue beleued iudge suche sinned second sect sadduceis cloked theyr wickednes vnder glorious name sadducei much iuste holy taught neyther angell spirite life death god gaue lawe onely honestly quietly lyue receiuing god life reward iustice interpreted scripture according iudgement man reason neither thing wold concerning pertained maner theyr liuing plain epicure wonderfull thing hard ethnike opinion shuld crepe amonge pecu • ar people god •• rre openly afrayd teache constant lo • affirme life▪ remayned none life essei • ere thirde considering phariseis sadduceis vnder honest pretēce name folowe theyr lustes desyres▪ neyther almoste thing worthy theyr profession therfore thought thei declare seueritee life dedes wold called essei labourer studied sene holy part ledde anabaptistical life absteining matrimony willinge thinges cōmen among ariobarzanes nicomedes driuen realmes mithridates kyng pontus sociall warres italy beynge scarcely pacified incontinent began two warres daungerouse cruell whan sylla elected capitayn warre againste mithridates inuaded asia achaia marius greuousely displeased sylla yonge man preferred wherfore brought passe healpe tribune sylla shuld called home chosen capitayne warre soone sylla knowlege therof came army citee slue ambassadour marius incontinent brake towne fyghtinge againste marius sulpitius put marius flighte slue sulpitius appointyng c • octauius corn curna consul departed asia redargius wēt theyr schole gathered great numbre companion murder rauishmētes rapine bourninges filled italy ewin ii nepheu kynge finnane yere worlde 3892 yere christe 71 chosen kyng scottes britayne knovven 21 reigned 17 yeres resigned regall power vnto edeir 3 nepheu durstus warres macedone began lucullus triumphed lentulus gellius consules sent sword player fugitiues ouerthrowen wherefore warre committed charge crassus quickly vainquished sertorius traitrously slayn ī spain perpēna britayne knovven 20 helius sonne danellus yere christe 70 reigned ful one yere kynge britaine yere worlde 3893 prince isle ely toke name ¶crassus vainquisshed sworde plaiers pompeius ouerthrewe perpenna broughte spaniardes subiection britayne knovven 19 lud sonne hely succeded father yere worlde 3894 yere christe 99 reigned xi yeres britain sone made kyng refourmed state cōmon weale amēded lawes toke away vsages nought moreouer repaired citie londō thē called troynouant faire buildinges walles buylded west parte therof strong gate whiche vnto tyme reteyneth name him▪ called ludgate fynally dyed leauyng hym two sonnes androgeus theomantius age gouerne vncle cassiuelane obteined crowne chronicler write lōdō toke name lud hircanus 8 king iewes reigned one yere betwene brother aristobulus began ciuyle warres lucullꝰ subdued macedony • lucullus armeny yere worlde 3895 yere christe 68 aristobulus 9 king iewes reigned 6 yeres britayne knovven 18 ouercame brother hircanus hierico agrement made aristobulus shoulde reigne kinge leade priuate life lucullus vanquished tygranes put flight lachares kinge bosphorus one sonnes mithridates receyued amitee lucullus cn pompeius 40 dayes scoured mediterrane sea pyrates yere christe 67 warres candy began britayne knovven 17 whiche iland metellus thre yeres subdued yere worlde 3896 libya bequest appie kinge therof came handes romaine cn pōpeius assigned general capitayn mithridates yere worlde 3897 yere christe 66 britayne knovven 16 subiection battayle ouercame iberian albanes pharnaces son mithridates made warre vpon father besieged castel destitute helpe finding mercy son firste poysoned wife concubine daughter selfe thus ended mithridates life prynce great wisedome meruaylous industrye whiche perfectly could speake xxii language lyued 72 yeares reigned xl kept war xxx yeres continually romanes hauing alwaies company philosopher cunnyng men ☞marcus tullius cicero consul rome c antonius whose diuine eloquence abundant lerning sharpenesse witte dexteritee actes ardēt loue toward common weale countrey sufficiently expressed mortall mannes tunge penne auncestours named cicerone tulliꝰ appius noble king uolscis one progenie nose marke like chich whiche kinde pulse called cicer profyted eloquence greke latine companion merueilous admiracion also appolonius moste excellent oratour tyme hearing greatly abashed kepinge sylence long space sayde laste truely cicero prayse meruaile lamente greatlye fortune grece consyder onely noblenes dedes armes marciall affaire taken frome v valyantnesse puissance ye romains also great prayse glory lerninge whiche left vnto v translated rome whiche saying founden afterwarde true loke subtilitee logike commoditee secrete knowlage phylosophie morall naturall knew declared latine perfecte eloquence whiche wondred atnotwithstanding verye yonge man came practise rome studied abundantly ciuile lawes meruailously occupied greate weightye cause senatour continually semed busye weale publike yet doeth reade workes althoughe haue thyrd parte whiche wrote shall thynke neuer thing reade great auctours wrate bokes yet exploit wisedome diligence many great enterprise commoditee sauegarde countrey well warre peace whiche senate people gaue firste anye name father countrey ¶catiline enterprised conspiracy whyche great wisedome diligence cicero suppressed catiline slayne battayle antonius list reade history length let resorte booke intituled conspiracy catiline trāslated english thomas paynell abundantlye elaquently set forth yere worlde 3902 yere christe 61 pompeie subdued armenia britayne knovven 11 cappadocia paphlagonia medium cholcis iberia albania syria cilicia mesopotamia iudea arabia tryumphed hadde twise triumphed winninge spayne affrike time brought common treasure golde syluer money plate xx thousande talentes whiche common talentes amounted xx hundred thousande poundes yf great talentes 27 hundred 26 thousand 641 poundes 1 • 4 besides geuen souldiours whiche serued warres whereof may gathered wōderful ryches ye romains cassiuelan sonne heli britayne knovven 8 vulgar historiographer write yere worlde 3905 yere christe 58 death brother lud made gouernour britayn ruled xix yeres 8 yere reigne iulius cesar warred long 14 stretes bourned yere worlde 3910 yere christe 53 britayne knovven 2 clodius slayne milo moued sedicion rome yere worlde 3911 yere christe 52 ¶the preface thomas lanquet second parte history england haue hitherto briefli ronne ouer liues 72 kinges reigned britaine arriuall brute vnto comming cesar history wherof said vncertaine obscure yet neuerthelesse haue varyed vulgar opinion therof haue brought certaine ordre conferring history gestes world wherby haue better apparance truth come time briton beganne knowen romaine nacions world hauing also helpe credible historiens whiche lacked shall veritably better order set foorthe history better declaracion chronicle shall vnderstande numbres set inner side page signifie yeres reignes kīges britain wherby may perceiued yere reigne kinge anye notable thinge world done historye cesar haue gathered cōmentaries worshipful beda whome thinke credible newe historiens vuhen c iullus cesar warred seuen yeres fraunce germany yere christe 52 anni regum britannie 7 comming vnto part calais bolayne stande yere worlde 3911 determined make warre britaine whyche vntill time remayned vnfrequented vnknowen romaine quarell warres france perceyued frenchman haue much succour ayde thense wherfore preparinge lxxx shippes sayled britain first weried harde sharpe batayle sodein tempest nauy almoste destroyed retourned fraunce winter men nexte springe yere worlde 3912 yere christe 51 nauy beinge newe rigged encreased anni regum britannie 8 passed sea agayne greater army while went towarde ennemies lande shippes lying ankor againe tempest almost lost eyther thei driuen side thei stack fast el beyng driuen one vpon destroyed xl perisshed muche labour saued upon lande also horseman ot first encounter vanquished labienus tribune slayne seconde conflicte withoute great daunger men put briton flight poursued theym riuer thamis side wherof cassiuelā great multitude people kepinge bankes hable resiste violence force romains hid selues woodes sodeine eruption oftentimes inuaded meane time theyr strongest citee troynouāt▪ submitted self cesar deliuering vnto hostage whiche exāple also city folowed whereby cassiuelan many loss constreigned giue pledge agre britaine tributary people rome cesar like conquerour great noumbre prisoner sayled fraunce thus ended warres made britain whereby rather opened waye successours come thā deliuered dominion thereof conqueste made 2255 yeres vniuersall floude 1057 arriuall brute 702 buyldinge rome second yere 182 olimpiade 1116 yere conquest made willā normandy 1595 yeres present yere lord 1547 cassius president siria droue parthian thense cleopatra quene egipte reigned xxii yeres yere christe 49 laste house lagus anni regum britannie 12 yere worlde 3914 alexandrine chosen quene albeit younger brother pompeius receiued tuicion driuen hir royalme yet cesar restored hir againe hir realme vsed company familyarly cesars death antonius wedded warred augustus ouerthrowē sorowe wherof closed selfe tombe liue hauing two adder suckinge brestes died woman excellinge plesauntnes quickenes witte sumptuous ryotte muche one banket contending antonius excesse fare drank aperle resolued vineger estemed 100 sestertium budei amounteth value 250000 crounes money fifty thousand poundes ciuile warres betwene pompeius cesar began cccm men perished cesar absence required second time consul marcellus consul withstode senate also decreed cesar entre city without dimissed armye whiche cause cesar displeased came frō rauenia passing ouer rubicon ariminium meane pompeius consulles fled dyrra • hiū grece cesar entred rome spoiled tresoury besieged marsiles aristobulus deliuered cesar went iudea poysoned alexander son put death scipio yere worlde 1916 yere christe 47 cesar corfinio britayne knovven 12 submission receyued armye domitius suffered go frelye awaye spaine vanquished petreius afranius returned marsiles tooke towne thence went dyrrachium ouercome put flight pompeius 2400 men slayne thessaly met feldes pharsalia wher cruell doubtful bataile fought lengthe pompei put flighte loste 15000 souldiours ¶pompeius sleing alexandria egipt slaine tutours yonge ptolome yere worlde 1917 yere christe 46 britayne knovven 13 head sent vnto ceser seing wept thus ended noble pompei life sundry incomparable victory surnamed great indued many noble princely vertues body minde good grace visage child hode meued people rome entierly fauoure also singular beneuolence cōtinence liuing marcial experience pleasantnes speache fidelitee maners easines speking meruailously estemed neuer required thīg shamfastnes granted thing glad countinaunce visage appered alway nobilitie gentilnes flourisshing youthe shined maners princely reuerent sent sicily sil • perceyuing souldiours vnder guiding scatered robbed countreys went commanded euery one theyr swordes signed seale ringe shoulde wrong man waye wherin declared selfe onely valyaunt also iust righteous capitaine cesar entered alexandria beinge prouoked batail vanquished theym sette fyre nauye egipcians flame whereof inuaded lybrarye philadelphus wherein burned 40000 bookes kinge rebellinge agayne worlde 3918 first among romaynes toke name emperour reigned fullye three yeres brought monarchy world vnder romaine yere warred pompeians aphrike vanquished theym tapsus toke theyr campe 60 elephantes cato greefe sorowe herte countrey cesar brought seruage thraldome slue selfe u • ica iuba kinge mauritane hired one ryd life petr • ius scipio kylled selfes cesar commaunded neph • eu greatte pompei daughter pompeia put death cesar entred rome four triūphes yere worlde yere christe 44 created fourth time consull anni regum britannie 15 continuall dictatour taking monarche whole impire whiche thinges brought passe prepared make warre sonnes pompei spayne fortune diuers betwene last battayle whyche munda towne spayne foughte soo sore harde togither suche slaughter made old assured souldiours cesar ashamed geue backe wherby cesar despairinge wyn fielde would haue killed selfe leste renoume many cōquestes victory shuld haue fallen power yonge men whose father vanquished finally succouring men armye pompeis put flight one bretherne beinge slayne fleing away whiche battayle cesar finished ciuile warres whiche space v yeres troubled whole world antipater cesar cōstituted procuratour iudea cesar retourned rome reformed state common weale amended calender reducinge order yere course sonne founde cause leape yere honour memorye people attributed moneth quintilis whiche name called iulius contynued passing v monethes reste waringe insolent againste senatours takinge theyr lybertee frome theim conspired numbre 260 senatours gentilmē among brutus cassius chiefe whiche ides marche cesar came senate house xxiii woūdes slain among senatours thus cesar lost al whiche wyth bloude lx citezens 1192000 ennemies gotten filled world ciuile bloud likewise nowe filled senate owne bloud sorte cesar finished life man featnes warre excellinge al wrote man swifter red man faster one time could endite foure letter one furthermore suche clemency whome subdued warre great gentilnesse wonne hys veray frendes time sene element three sonnes one cercle suburbes rome oxe spake vnto plowman vayne droue shortly al onely corne also men shuld fayle dolobella substituted place cesar souldiours smyrna killed trebonius one murtherers cesar antipater reedefied walles hierusalem ordeyned herode president galilee yere christe 42 theomantius sonne lud neuew cassiuelan yere worlde succeded roialme britain reigned quietly xxiii yeres c cesar octauianus augustus second emperour rome reigned lvi yeres saye twelue antonius lepidus xliiii alone soone herde deathe vncle iulius hasted appolonia rome possesse inheritance reuenge death cesar ciuile war againe renued senate fauored kyllers cesar antonius wold haue suppressed theim ciuil warre whiche cause iudged senate bee ennemye rome consules hircius pansa octauianus sente agaynste vanquished consules slayne antonius fled vnto lepidus maister horseman whose meanes recōciled octauianus thre ioyntly toke vpon theim gouernaunce one soo muche driuen antonius oute rome sharpe oracyons caused proclaimed enemie weale publike made saide antony much foe treatie peace betwene octauius demaunded cicero pleasure▪ whiche graunted vnkinde octauius whome cicero brought vp caused made chiefe gouernor romaine wherfore antonius sent one herennius cicero saued death eloquēce slea pursued fledde oute citee whiche thing cicero worlde humilitye whiche tyme wekes daniel beinge fulfylled taughte euerye moste constantly euen crosse partly mightie woorde partelye effectuall woorkes kingedome god true knowledge god father excedinge charitee towardes mankynde sure confidence son god declaring also waye helth mutuall loue rewardes faithful punishmentes vnfaithful thenfor confirmacion doctrine faithe euē litle becke commaunded calmenesse elementes helthe disease lyfe vnto deade obedyence vnto quicke detection vnto thoughtes abolicion vnto sinnes flight vnto deuell passion labour man miserye whiche suffered sinne onelye excepte whereby witnessed hym selfe veray man innumerable documentes beneficiall deedes passing mannes power openly shewed vnto vnkinde people iewes whiche declared selfe true god written prophetes elder iewes people disciple iudas scarioth betrayinge taken accused endited scorned scourged crowned thornes crucified betwene theeues euen thinges fulfylled quakinge erthe darkenesse sonne died whyche beynge buried loused hell thirde daye folowinge lyke conquerour sinne death hell rose againe whiche time beinge xl day conuersaunt xxxiii yere lyfe glorious triumphe ascended heauens vnto father whense cam beinge onely▪ mediatour intercessour aduocate sittinge righte hande god father shall ende worlde iudge ouer liuing deade rendringe euery man according deseruinge faythefull certainlye life vnfaythful euerlasting death good euyll segregated whole worlde purged pacifyed lorde iesu christe onely veray almighty emperour worlde hath beginninge soo dothe euer shall reygne euerye knee celestiall terrestrial infernall creature shal bow euery tongue shall confesse iesus chryste lorde glorye god father whome bee glory worlde without ende amen yere christ 2 ¶eusebius cesarensis began ecclesiasticall historye place yere worlde 399 anni regum britannie 20 christ eight day natiuitee circumsised xiii worshipped wise men seconde february presented temple night folowing tiberius priuily caused agrippa slaine yere worlde 3977 ¶ claudius tiberius nero cesar anni regum britannie 34 iii emperour rome yere christ 16 son bothe mariage adoption augustus reigned 23 yeres metely politike fortunat warre well learned endued muche eloquence veraie mischeuous cruel couetous disceitfull wit feygning thing whiche wolde whiche would sodeine answer better whiche studied firste feygned vnwillingly toke vpon greuous troublous charge empyre wheras certain counsail moued leauy exaction people answered office good shepherde shere shepe pyll theim written put deathe smith inuented make glasse flexible laiyng charge lyue teache golde siluer nothinge bee estemed suppressed getulians craftily circumuented marobodus kinge sueuians poisoned also drusus germanicus sonnes brother drusus ¶the printer ¶hitherto said yong man thomas lanquet continued history called epitome cronicles attached greuous sicknesse whereof dyed▪ whan age xxiiii yeres whose soule god haue mercy folowed finished thomas couper instāt request made length content take vpon peine well considered labour trauaill accordinge first inuencion searche reade ouer many diuers history cronicles accomplishe saide purpose ¶an epistle reader beginninge worlde thys tyme byrth sauiour christ studious younge man thomas lanquet without great laboure diligence broughte hys chronicle whose enterprise honest affection therein declared towarde countrey thinke worthye memorye might haue gon begō wel brought forwarde vndoubtedly woulde greatly haue delighted theim take pleasure reade notable famous thinges done longe tyme hathe briefely set foorthe gestes actes forayne straunge countreis therwith iuigned hystorie realme englande opinion writer euen firste arriuing brutus wyse diligent reader maye gather variable state condicion countreis nacions tymes deathe whiche spareth man ne bee eschewed brake course trypped hym myddes hys rase coulde atteyne marke wherat ranne wherfore lest desyre profitable knowlege history destituted great commoditee lest fruites diligent labour shoulde lye hydde tourne profyte man instance certaine nyghest frendes whose requestes matter standing could well denie haue taken vpon fynishe cronicle although dede greatly dispaired shulde able accomplishe considered firste though harde matter yet might ouercomen labour howe profitable exercise bee reade peruse many good auctours necessary performaunce thirdly howe honeste labour employ vacant time necessary business sho • e vnprofitable bashefulnesse haue enterprised onely finishe warke also ouersight correction men haue suffered published wherfore gentyll reader shall take well worthe boldenesse perswade youre selfe trouthe moued excercise rather good wille▪ profytte natural countrey pleasure men fame aduauncemēt hoped might come therby se ye take well gree vndoughtedly shal encourage hereafter goo hande exercise shal perchaunce tourne profytte pleasure theim whiche desirous honest knowlege vale deathe octauius augustus second cesar thinges happened rome somtime doeth commen weales decesse great prince ruler sediciō vnquietnesse trouble souldiours pannonie raised greate sedicion rage beatte murdered diuers tribune officer cōmocion much peines lastly quyeted drusus sonne tiberius like maner like cause great trouble vnquietnes hoste lay germanie time whan germanicus captaine exhorteth quietnes souldiours obstinately refused empire tiberius profered make emperour germanicus wolde rather haue slaine selfe hys owne weapen thē vnlawful meanes obteine imperiall auctoritee moreouer common citee rome diuers noble also hauing hertes naturall hatred towarde monarchy highe power cesars diuised imagined theim selfes diuerslye howe extinguishe imperial auctoritee bring citee pristinate gouernaunce consulles thing ernestlye desired muche yet freshe inmemorie swetenes theyr ancient libertees fame man • e noble men whiche iulius augustus bene outlawed put deathe also feared proude cruell nature tiberius named succede augustus empire al notwithstanding tyberius wyth suche craft dissimulacion handeled matter onely obteyned imperiall auctoritee also seemed take vpon time notable warre sauinge romaine made fierce warre vpon germaines rather reuenge infamy q uarus receyued theyr handes enlarge theyr empyre time spred selfe well ner ouer world iudea herode philyp buylded repayred certaine city townes honour cesar made theym ruler herode whiche also called antipas walled citee called sephoris named anthoccadorida like maner citee bethaurata whiche called iulia philip buylded paniada aboute well iordaine named cesaria erected also bethsayda nye riuer genasar gaue name iulia omonima germanicus cesar romaine capitaine nye wood cesia vainquished slue phraates made theyr king shortly vnconstantly agayne deposed germanicus nie vnto riuer gisurgis ouercame put flight germains called cherusci riuer tiberis ouerflowed citee rome wherof great ruine decay buyldinge mortalitee people ensued lawe published wherby inchaunters southsayers whiche knowlage mathematicall magical science banished italy also romaine theyr table shoulde serued riche ordeined place thinge caused great discention among bishop ataulphus ordeined kinge wisigothes entended vtter destruction citee rome haue buylded citee fame place whiche shoulde called gothia pelagius horrible heretike liued britaine taught men wer saued iustified mere mercye god death merite iesu christe yere worlde 4376 yere christ 415 owne good workes natural operacions men obteined god perfect iustificacion remission sinnes errour sainct augustine cōfoū deth many woorkes attalus healpe gothes vsurped imperial authoritee france passed then spaine yere worlde 4377 yere christ 416 spaine afrike heraclianus romaine duke sent afrike factours attalus traiterously toke imperiall auctoritee burgonnions obteyned part fraunce nere ryuer rhine heraclianus counsaile companion sabinus prepared wonderfull nauie whiche 4070 shippes theim made towarde rome againste emperour shortly arriuall discoumfited shamefully put flight wise constreigned flie carthage small shippe slaine shortly iewes whiche time alexandre great▪ daie inhabited citee alexandria yere worlde 4378 yere christ 417 sedicion whiche caused nowe driuen citee gooddes taken theim woman▪ named hippacia excellentlye learned passed philosopher time rede openly philosophie schole alexandria attalus traitour beynge forsaken adherentes taken afrike sent emperour gothes slewe kinge ataulphus desired peace romains chose regericus lyke cause also murdered lastly aduanced king noble mā called wall • certaine misfortune sea contrary exspectacion made league constantius romaine whiche time hadde subdued barbarous according history vnder kinge fergus returned ireland albion continuing reigne iii kinges fergus eugenius dongarde pursued britaines cruell warres discente englisshe cronicles well computacion time relacion whole storie beda gildas anciēt credible writer scottes came firste time irelande countrey whiche called scotlande howe euer story agree trueth scottes beynge confederate pictes long time consente writer inuaded spoyled lande britaine cruelly britain constreigned sende ayde romaine promissing woulde perpetually subiect empyre whiche request harde capitaine sent legion knightes within day chased enemy lande teachinge make wal turnes stake water humbre scottisshe sea wherewith ennemies mighte kepte backe lande toke leaue britaines departed barbaranes kinge persian persecute christian yere worlde 4385 yere christ 424 whiche cause deadlye warre arrered betwene persian romaine ardaburus romaine capitaine spoyled countrey called azazena whiche misfortune persian began intreate peace castinus duke romaine sent uandales whyche wasted landes empyre spaine somwhat preuailed healpe valyaunt knight named bonifacius whiche came oute afrike ayde hym business empyre deathe husbande certaine displeasure driuen brother honorius two sonnes fled theodotius emperour easte gentilly interteined honorius emperour weast departed oute life rome yere worlde 4387 yere christ continued space 483 yeres time brutus began rule lande 1541 citee rome buylded thousand fiue hundred eyghtie fiue ¶the ende first boke ¶the prologue seconde boke hitherto haue compediouslye noted gestes actes briton theyr prince lande subiecte tributarie roman credite annexing alwayes history romains externall realmes done anye thinge woorthy memorie menglinge also notable thinges perteining christes church faith whiche nere simple witte learning could compasse haue diligently obserued continuall course ordre history euery countrey whose actes woorke touched according first promise diligent reader may hold mirrour glasse state condicion time onely englande also italy fraunce spaine partes world whiche sorte god willing purpose go foreward part folowing concerning realme england zambases chosen kinge odoacer beyng ouercome battaile theodorike fled rome founde gate shutte hym wherwith beyng sore greeued spoyled wyth swoorde fyre muche countrey li • nge aboute myghte come then fledde rauenna besieged theodorike space iii yeres meane tyme gundabalde kynge burgoyne anni regum britannie 12 entred italy yere worlde yere christ 492 cruelly robbyng destroiynge many ryche citees retourned home great spoyle ledde great numbre prisoner clodoueus kynge fraunce toke mariage crothilde mayden excellent fauour beautie whiche right inheritour great parte burgoyne neece gundabalde kinge gundabalde treason murdered owne brother father forenamed crothilde whiche cause arrered deadlye warre betweene clodouey kinge burgoyne kingdome east saxones beganne britaine vnder duke named uffa kingdome whereof conteined nortff suff kinges lordshyp called uffynes greate murder vexacion britaines entringe saxones odoacer whiche besieged rauenna beinge constreigned great scarcitee hūger yelded theodorich anni regum britannie 13 yere worlde 4454 yere christ 493 bothe sonne put death theodorich vanquished odacer receyued rome senate people wyth much myrth gladnesse reigned lorde italy 3 • yeres veray desirous peace quietenesse profitable italye therewith benigne gentill moderate prince rome neuer better gouernour chosen among auncient senatours barbarous kinge hauing progenye rude people gothes gaue muche churche large stipendes preacher teacher worde god yet fauoured heresye arrius al gothes zenon ended life reigne constantinople whō anastitius obteined imperiall crowne whiche might numbred among good emperours bene corrupted heresie eutices wherby became odious true christian persecuted somewhat catholike bishop anni regum britannie 15 cabades kinge persian yere worlde 4456 diligent labour wife delyuered prison yere christ 495 helpe hunnes restored regalitee made warre vpō people armenie mesopotamia toke citee amida theodorich whan slaine odoacer gaue inhabitance people called heruli parte italye nere alphes anastatius east recouered agayne citee amida yere worlde 4457 yere christ 496 taken persian anni regum britannie 16 made peace vii yeres hapned great tumulte discencion anni regum britannie 19 almost ciuile warre rome yere worlde 4460 yere christ 499 election symmachus byshop many men slaine discencion quieted theodorich transamundus kyng uandales afrike banished 220 byshops thei resisted heresie arrius olimpius arrian blasphemyng trinitee sodeinely striken lightnyng ende reigne aur • ly king britain pascentius yōgest sonne uortiger feare aurelius fled irelande inuaded lande great armie whiche season aurelius sicke wynchester therfore sent brother uter resist malyce pascetius ouercame enemy fyght slew pascentius muche church made many lawes concerninge libertee priestes time colme irelande mungo holy bishop blasquew scotlande yere christ 571 narses whose knighthode wisedome gothes expelled italy yere worlde 4532 anni regum britannie 20 enuious cōplaint certaine noble men malicious suggestion sophia empresse sent letter italy eunuke wordes reproche commanded retourn constantinople destribute flaxe yarne emp • resse hādmaidens whiche wordes greatly mened wrate wise theyr vnkindenesse would begyn spinne suche threde empresse hir power neuer able make end therof forthwith departed rome naples remaining intised lumbardes warre vpon italy childerich sonne soysons fraunce repudyate second wife golsand toke fredegunda woman exellent beautie time vsed wife yere christ 572 longinus sent emperour succede gar gouernance italy yere worlde 4533 anni regum britannie 21 ordeyned brought new maiestrates rome called exarchi chaunged much ancient fourme gouernance italye athanagildus kinge spaine dyed tolet succeded limba iii yeres gaue principate brother leonogildus narses counsayle iohn pope anni regum britannie 22 called againe rome yere christ 573 made consul vnwitting emperour yere worlde 4534 narses ended hir life rome anni regum britannie 23 whiche time lumbardes inuaded italy yere worlde 4535 yere christ 574 leuing countrey panonie hunnes called hungarie lumbardes partly force partly dedicion receyued uincentia uerona millain diuers citees italy yere christ 575 longe time warre arrered yere worlde 3536 betwene chilperich france mother segibert anni regum britannie 24 certayne lande claymed brother chilperich first somewhat fordele ī fine peace concluded leonogilduswas ordeined kinge wisigothes spaine reigned xviii yeres chased suytzers spaine slewe theyr king • ca 17 • yeres hadde first setled kingedome countrey anni regum britannie 25 chilperich brake league made brother sigibert yere worlde 4537 yere christ 576 sent sonne clodouey warre vppon towne called burdeaux prouince neustria alboynus kinge lumbardes anni regum britannie 26 conquered pauie yere worlde 4538 possessed gallia cisalpina nowe called lumbardye great part italye lyinge next alpes yere christ 577 entreatie peace made betwene chilperich sigibert accorded fell agrement make warre vpon theyr thirde brother gunthranus anni regum britannie 27 alboynus kinge lumbardes yere worlde 4539 yere christ 578 banket drinkinge masarre made scul commundꝰ wife father wyth woordes reproch minded wife father death wherewith beynge greued entending reuenge hir father quarel fyrst committed aduoutrie noble yonge man called helmelchildis entised slea hir husbande whiche thinge done fought fearinge crueltie lumbardes fled longinup lieuetenant italy taking great treasure rich ethelbert king saxones kent gaue battayle ceawlmus kinge west saxones whyche fight slayne ii duke ethelbert selfe people chased fyrste warre betweene saxones lande dwelling within countrey britaine kinnatil brother conwallus reigned scotlande iiii monethes aidane 27 yeares time variance hapned betwene pictes scottes lerudeus king pictes wold restore aidane certaine traitours whiche fled land iustine emperour dyed tyberius chiefe gouernour vnder anni regum britannie 28 yere worlde 4540 yere christ 579 adopcion sonne obteyned empire man wise valiant iust merciful liberall toward pore religion true christian tyme seing floore palaice signe crosse vpon great marble stone meued religion commaunded stone taken vp vnder whiche founde like vnto vnder iii fourth whyche beynge remeued founde place vnestimable rich money moreouer treasure also narses hydde grounde hym disclosed whiche war almost innumerable great rich rosimunde brought italie longine lieuetenāt also receiued thus god prouideth liberal prince good poore rosimunde counsaile longinus lieuetenant italie gaue poyson hir new husbande holmelchildis immediatly perceiuyng strength poyson receiued inforced hir drinke remnant bothe endynge iiues one poyson woorthily rewarded aduoutrie murder theim committed cutwalphus sonne cerdicus king weast saxones fought valiauntly britaines berafte theim iiii great townes clephis fierce outragious tyranne chosen kyng lumbardes subdued lordship dyuers citees italie longe hys crueltee slayne owne people sigibert making sharpe warre vpon brother childerich yere worlde yere christ 580 besieged citee turney 4552 yere christ 591 vnder gouernaunce duke anni regum britannie 3 ordeyned theyr kynge valiant younge man called antharis sonne clephis leon • gil • u kynge spayne slewe owne sonne hermengilde woulde consent heresie arrius britaine ethelfr • dus gouerned north saxones made suche continual warre vpō britain yere worlde 4553 yere christ anni regum britannie 4 chased sore thought slew mo saxon kynges hys crueltie faieth christ almost vtterly extinguisshed among britaines continued sen time lu • ie 400 yeres manye britaynes chased lande • haris kyng lumbardes inuaded • ystria spoyled countrey sworde fyre yere worlde yere christ 593 anni regum britannie 5 dyscomfyted fransilyo president gallia cisalpina toke citee cumus ouermuche raine hapned great floude al countrey italie riuers ouerflowed manye citees townes great damage inhabytauntes whych vnseasonable weather rose also great dearth pestilence famine occasion wherof gregorie ordayned first latinie songe 7 partes richaredus ordeined king spaine man calling counsayle tolet condēned heresy arrius caused catholike fayth receiued people anni regum britannie 6 childebert one kinges fraunce gaue sister mariage richaredus bauarians chased theyr kinge gariabalde countrey possessed lordship bauarie teudelina brother gondoald fled italie anthaxis childebert besieged citee trent italye spoyled countrey wyth muche crueltee religion godlinesse greatly decayed among christian men couetousnesse arrogancie desire worldly pompe reigned onely hertes prince common people also especiallie bishoppes prelate churche little tyme iohn patriarke constantinople intollerable pride made suite mauritius emperour called chiefe bishop gregorie bishop rome vehemently withstode wrate agaynst extremely diuers epistle saying firste broughte example antichrist churche claimed name vniuersall bishop derogacion al diuers like wordes great reproche uppon occasion geuen iohn byshop constantinople boniface beyng time made bishop rome obteyned phoca emperour called vniuersall chiefe bishop nothing regarding eyther commaundement instruction christ sayyng disciple whiche woulde highest among lowest eyther el example godly men time decree ancient counsailes whiche alwaye abhorre suche title name extreme pride vsed churche saint cyprian writing often cornelius bishop rome neuer calleth otherwise brother felowe bishop▪ like founde woorkes tertullian hierome chrisostome augustine auncient writers▪ yea coūsayle carthage hold yere lord 419 217 bishop presente auctoritee bishop rome sumwhat controuersie decreed none called chiefe bishop wyse bishop chiefe see whiche honour gaue rome seate royall empyre establyshe auctoritee ouer church thinges saye nothing regarded boniface beganne fyrst vsurpe primacie romain bishop haue euer sence falsly alleged giuen scripture aboue bishop wherfore seeing gregory estemed iohn constantinople brynge church example antichrist sued name vniuersall bishoppe euery man maye easelye iudge bee thoughte successoures gregorye sea rome haue onely take vpon name derogacion bishop gregory complaineth also bee called heade vniuersall church christes vicar earth name city blaspgemy great dishonour god callengyng also vsurping vnder pretence full iurisdiction auctoritee onely ouer whole clergy also ouer emperours kinges prince worlde alteringe disposing realm kingdomes pleasure ree • ing moste deadlye warres vtter disturbance christendome yea moste vntollerable auauntinge theym selfe decree haue auctoritee aboue woorde god interpretacion therof onely theyr handes saye could erre yet errours encreased ryches magicall artes also great honour foolishe people wherfore counsail sergius called selfe great prophet god shortly name publyshed great auctoritye deuised lawe kinde religion called alcaron whiche toke part wel nere heresy bene time wyth sabellian deuided trinit • e wyth manyches affirmed two persones deytee denied equalitee father son wyth eunonius sayde macedone holy ghost expelled owne brother obteined kingdome spaine reigned vii yeres quincellinus kinge west saxones certayne grudge displeasure sent sword man priuy • ne slea murdre edwine northumberland whiche cruell intencion beynge shortly espyed edwine made fierce warre vpon quincellinus hym vanquished battaile slew great noumbre souldiours brunichild woman peruerse euyll disposicion maligned alway clothayre king france hir nephewe▪ therfore excited one sigisberde claime lande austracie ende sigiderd taken slaine brunichild hir manifold mischieue put vile shamefull deathe time bene occasion deathe x prince beside edwine king northumberlande baptised holy bishop paulinus manye people clothayre released lumbardes tribute 12 thousande poundes sette vppon gunthranus vncle edwine kinge northumberlande dagobert king fraunce whiche lyued moderate good prince yere worlde 4598 yere christ 637 anni regum britannie 3 waxed nowe cruell tyranne exaction pilled people beside crueltee geuen al sensual lust body cruelly destroyed countrey poeters • ared stretes citee sowed therin sault token vtter destruction subdued also scla • ines gascosnes shewed toward thē great crueltee heraclius emperour fell forsoke obedience emperour muche thei dimissed wage anni regum britannie 8 yere worlde 4603 yere christ 642 beforee hyred souldiours vnder emperours capitaines cōquered damascus toke phenicia spoiled theodorus made lieutenant italy heraclianus made emperour mother martina reigned notfull ii yeres penda kinge mertia warred vpon oswald good holy king northumberland slew battaile many knightes yere worlde 4605 yere christ 644 mertina emperours mother anni regum britannie 10 murder committed iudgement senat tongue cut also banished sonne emperour whiche nose cut token reproche consentinge cruell anna kinge eastangles yere worlde 4617 yere christ 656 slew open fielde whiche victory penda elated pride sent defiance oswie northūbarland hearing comminge tyran proferred greate giftes fayre condicions peace penda obstinately refused entreatie concorde therefore shortly slayne battaile xxx noble capitaines although thrise noumbre people oswie thus heaten blouddye pagane ended crueltee whiche dyuers warres longe season tourmented land britaine martine pope banished constantine emperour whiche time sea rome voide xiii monethes great famine dearth manye died lacke sustinance bennet monke maister reuerent beda famous britaine bennet broughte firste crafte glasinge lande anni regum britannie 23 sarasens whiche great crueltie contynuall warres hadde spoyled asia afrike yere worlde ambassadours demaunded zacharie pope bounden friende thys questiō whether worthy king kinge onely name natural succession el whiche bare bourden kingdome alone yet lacked dignitie kinge meanynge hym selfe pope aunswered ryghtfull toke charge thinges called king whose iugement pipine presuming deposed childerich made selfe king beginneth newe progenie kinges fraunce childerich laste kinge stocke warres whiche time remembring vnnaturall mindes owne child sorowe fel suche lamentable weping could speake good space buried meaws mother hildegarde longe death lewys great distaunce warre chaunced betwene iii bretherne diuision theyr father landes lewis lothayre maligned charles theyr yonger brother chiefe father landes myddle fraunce assigned porciō wherfore ere longe cause cruell warre arrered whiche charles souldiours behaued theim manlye bretherne vanquished battaile forced forsake fielde whyche conflict moe frenchman slaine euer afore daye battaile thus blouddyly ended entreatie peace made agrement whereof fraunce diuided iii partes anni regum saxo 9 yere worlde 4802 lothayre geuen austracie landes empyre yere christ 841 lewys germany guyan charles middle france prouinces whiche custome remaineth amonge daye company dane inuaded englande vexed inhabitantes al crueltee especially countrey kent ende constreigned forsake lande flie theyr shippes bearing great rich treasure alphons king spayne yere christ 844 mistrusting three bretherne hadde conspired priuy meanes dispatche lyfe anni regum saxo 12 commanded eien put yere worlde 4805 cast prison discorde worke treason toward constātine anni regum angli 6 yere worlde 4906 soonne leo yere christ 945 bothe taken caste monasterye perpetuall bondage whyche tyme constantine reigned east xvi yeres blasing sterre appeared italie edmunde kynge englande ended hys lyfe whome succeded hys brother eldred anni regum angli 1 yere worlde 4907 yere christ 946 edwyne edgare hys sonnes thoughte younge take theim greate charge eldrede earnest fauoure common greate maynteinour honestye moste infest enemye naughtye vnrulye person expertnesse feates armes muche commended wherby quieted kepte dewe obeysaunce northumbers scortes exyled dane agapitus second bishop rome ix yeres henry brother otho emperoure beynge besieged mersburge submitted selfe brother· whome pardoned deathe berthold duke bayon aduāced sayde duchie henry duke ofbayon bauarye yere worlde 4908 yere christ 947 looke citee aquileia iustinoples chased slewe hungares anni regum angli 2 beringarius aforetime fledde swaue retourned armye italye time italyans forsoke king hugh communication concluded lothayre sonne hughe shoulde named king beringarius chiefe auctoritee remained beringarius whiche ruled greate auarice tyrannye taxi kynge hungares entred italie pretendyng great crueltee yere worlde 4909 yere christ 948 anni regum angli 3 praiers riche gyftes beringarius returned countrey withoute doyng harme harolde kyng denmarke beyng expelled kyngdome sonne swenon yere worlde 4910 yere christ 1949 anni regum angli 4 excited hys kinsman normains set vppon countrey fraunce toke lewys kynge prisoner afterwarde restored frenchemen set rycharde possession father duch • e normandie nowe age take charge thereof maried doughter hugh legraunte erle paris whiche mariage cause trouble betweene normains kynge lewys whome otho also emperoure ayded hys warres yet notwithstandynge normains alway vpper hande otho ledde armie boizlai king bohome anni regum angli 5 hym besieged newe citee yere worlde 4911 yere christ 950 submitted hym power became hys subiecte lyndolphus sonne otho anni regum angli 7 findynge hym selfe greued foresaied mariages yere worlde 4913 yere christ 952 gathered greate power agaynste hys father eche greued cruell warre vntyll length lyndolphus reconsyled hys father notwithstandynge dyuers metynges shewed hym selfe veraye dysobedient stubburne hungares wasted countrei france uormana yere brother germaine makbeth yere worlde yere christ 1041 hardikinutus anni regum angli 1 king denmarke deathe harolde ordeyned kinge englande iniurie done mother emma caused corp harolde taken sepulcre smyting head cast riuer thames burdened subiectes exaction tribute meate drinke prodigall hys table spred iiii tyme daye people serued great excesse reygned iii yeares dyed sodeinly nai without suspection poysoning yere worlde 5003 yere christ 1042 yeare erle englande called godwine man great power ruled muche lande anni regum angli whiche vniustlye slewe alfrede sonne etheldrede brother edwarde vsed extreme crueltie toward normaines whiche accompanied saide alfrede came normandye 〈◊〉 visite mother emma emperour henry ouercame bohemes made tributary peter kinge hungarie lecherie crueltee depriued royall aucthoritye aba fledde ayde henry emperour germany humfrei norman brother drogon succeded erldome pu • l hardikinitus ended lyfe whose death dane beaten slaine driuen oute lande theyr owne countrey 28 yeres sueno began fyrste reigne edwarde sonne egeldrede etheldrede yere worlde 5004 yere christ aduyse godwine leofricus erle chester deathe hardikinitus sente normandie anni regum angli 1 take hym gouernance realme england whiche guided muche wysedome iustice 24 yeres issued oute fountayne verie godlynesse mercy pites lyberalitee towarde poore gentilnesse iustice toward men honest life gaue goodly example people discharged englisshemen greate tribute called dane gelde whiche often tyme leuied impouerishyng people subdued also welshemen whiche rebelled made warre vpon borderer peter kynge hungarye agayne restored kyngdome aba alboyne healpe emperour henrie expelled magnus kynge norway hearynge deathe hardikinitus great puisance inuaded denmarke expelling sueno lieuetenante subdued countrey signorie meane denmarke became subiect northgaynes michaell calaphates whiche adopted zoe great vnkyndnesse sent hir banisshemente wherfore bereft sight put empyre whome constantine monomathus made emperour constantinople maried zoe empresse reigned xii yeres anni regum angli 2 romains depryned bennet ix hys byshoprike ordeined hys place siluester iii bennet▪ yere worlde 5005 yere christ within short space beyng restored fee fearyng againe depryued sold hys roome one iohn archedeacon called gregory vi makbeth reigned among scottes xvi yeres whiche beginnyng dyd many thinges profyte realme became cruell tyranne vanquisshed slayne malcome ayde englishemen yere worlde 5008 yere christ 1047 counsaile erle godwine anni regum angli 5 robert byshop canturburye emma mother kynge edwarde englande vniust accusacions put great iniuries deliuered miracle passing ouer ix plough share burnyng hote fyre without hurt domage certaine pyrates dane entred englande hauen sandwiche whiche chased dryuen ship henrye emperour hauyng knowlage discorde betwene bishop rome went thytherwarde stronge armye assemblyng synode condemned iii troublous monster bennet syluester gregorie made switgerus byshop whiche named ii clemente whome receiued imperyall diademe prohibited romaynes thensfoorthe chose anybyshop whiche thing cause moste deadly warres clement christ 1052 perceiuyng anni regum angli 10 coulde withstande kynges malyce fled flaunders outlawed edwarde repudiated hys wyfe doughter erle godwine gysulphus erle puel inuaded citee boneuent force toke withhelde tribute whiche churche babenberge payeth yeerely romayne bishop leo bishoppe rome hauing ayde emperoure went armie gysulphus anni regum angli 11 yere worlde yere christ fyrste encounter hym vanquyshed taken prisoner shortly sent agayne sauefely rome william bastarde duke normandye aboute tyme came goodlye company englande honourably receiued kyng made great chere retourne enriched great giftes pleasures▪ write made promyse hym▪ dyed withoute issue willyam shoulde succede kingdome england erle godwine reconsiled kynge edwarde called banisshmente anni regum angli 12 yere worlde yere christ hys trueth good bearynge gaue pledge hys ii sonnes byornon toston whiche sent duke normandye kept anni regum angli 13 scottes rebelled kyng edwarde wherfore edwarde erle northumberlande assembled hoste entred lande subdued scottes yere worlde 5016 yere christ 1055 chased kynge realme gaue kyngdome malcolme malcoline sonne kynge cumbres whiche scottyishe historye setteth tyme yere lord 1061 erle godwine sate table kyng edward hapned one cuppe bearer stumble recouer agayne dyd sheade none drynke whereat godwine lowgh sayed nowe one brother hathe susteigned whiche wordes king calling minde brother death slaine godwyne behelde erle saiynge shoulde brother alphrede haue holpen ne godwine ben godwyne fearing kynges displeasure newly kendled many wordes excusing selfe saied mought sauelye swallow morsell bread giltlesse deede soone receiued breade forthwith choked uictor bishop rome ii yeres anni regum angli 14 algarus erle oxenford yere worlde 5017 yere christ euil coūsaile wythout gylte banyshed fled wale shortly reconsiled kyng theodora gouerned empyre constantinople ii yeares henrie emperour germanie departyng life committed yonge son tuicion baldwine▪ erle flaunders sewarde erle northumberlande dyed redde yere worlde 5018 yere christ 1057 whan sawe well shoulde dye anni regum angli 15 caused armoure put hym armed place sittynge cheire sayed became noble man dye liyng another meane person henrye iiii beyng yet chylde ordeyned emperour germanie reigned 50 yeres tyme meane trouble sedicion warre romayne empyre greatly appayred neuer could restored prystinate maiestye recouer againe former might puisaunce causers whereof byshoppes rome whiche vexed well nere whole worlde moste cruell deadly warres specially hildebrande called gregory vii saxones vnder leadyng duke otho rebelled yere worlde yere christ 1058 ecbert emperours capitayne anni regum angli 16 vanquisshed brought subiection michaell surnamed elder emperoure constantinople one yere great businesse rufflynge rome election deposicion certayne byshops stephene ix bennet x nicolas iii andrew king hungary vanquished one bela depriued kingdome emperours armie whiche came rescue ouerthrowen kyng andrewe slayne marque thurynge constreigned hunger famine yelde hym selfe hys enemyes bela force toke hym crowne reigned iii yeares isacius murdered michaell emperoure constantinople yere worlde 5020 yere christ 1059 reigned place iiii yeres anni regum angli 17 algarus erle mertia whiche erle oxenforde beyng maliciously accused exiled oute lande king edwarde seconde time fledde againe griffine duke wale wherwith edward greuouslye displeased sente harolde eldest sonne godwine great power warre vppon saide griffine spoyled countrey wale expelled griffyne lordship policie beganne dominion ouer realme englāde anni regum angli 1 reigned 35 yeares henrie noble valiant prince stronge myghtie body hygh stature blacke heared great staryng eies comely visage pleasant sweete countinance greatly abhorred excesse meates drinkes thre thinges excellent witte eloquence good happe battayle thereto iii contrary vice couetousnesse crueltee lust body yet geuen vice farre excelled vertue beginnyng refourmed state condiciō clergie releised greeuous paymentes reduced agayne edwardes lawes amendemente theim restored anselme bishop canturbury banisshemente toke wife maude syster tusculanes refused paye fowage theym exacted made fierce warre▪ vpon theim ayde germaines selues vanquisshed slayne greate noumbre frederich emperour retournyng rome subdued great parte border angli 14 spreading false rumour death asia also reiecting louing letter publishinge enemy christian religion lesse hated sarasen turke yet ceassed thys gentyll prince returne entreat meanes concord hungarie slaine comanes succeded andrewe thirde whiche reygned • ii yeres rodolph emperour almaine ouerthrew wel nere 60 castelles holdes prouince thuring meanes quieted countrey germanie andrewe king princely vertues excellēt noble men time compared beginninge chefely ordered sir roger mortimer mother isabell robert kinge scottes sent defiaunce yonge kinge edwarde inuaded border england kinge edward made preparacion toward scotland time fel great variance betwene archer englande souldiours sir iohn • eynalde shortly english army border sore distressed lacke forage necessary great daunger treason sir roger mortimer scottes escaped without battaile wherby kinge loste vyage hys charge counsayle sir roger mortimer olde queene king edward made dishonourable peace scottes restored theim auncient wrytinges charter patentes whereby kynges scotland obliged thē • udaries crowne englande like vnprofitable condition lewys emperour instance many noble mē italye came millaine according ye ancient custome crowned diademe yron iohn bishoppe rome excommunicated lewys disanulled election vsed imperial diggnitee italy auctorised thys variance continued well nere xx yeares whyche emperour profered often time make entreatie concorde peace stife necked tyranne rome wolde neuer bende writinges bothe partes concerning controuersie remaine dayes byshop feareth make auaunte full power create depose kinges emperours pleasure tyme many learned men whiche greatly disalowe byshop rome doynges amonge whiche occham man dayes great fame boke also made learned man geuē emperour called defensor pacis defēdour peace wherin controuersy disputed bishop rome vnlawfull tyran nie sette forth vttermost great cause variance write bicause one emperours secretary vnknowing emperour cerayne letter toward flaunders yere worlde 5301 hauen sciuse mette frenche kinges nauye yere christ foughten cruell batayle wherof king englande victorie french flete noumbre 400 sayle wel nere al destroyed souldiours taken slayne drowned 33000 scaped one shortly king besieged turney continuinge time whiche siege diuers outridinges enterprise ventured henoways almains frendes great hurte bothe partes fell still frenchemen ende xi wekes peace agreed vpon space xii monethes▪ kinge edward retourned englande passetime scottes steringe ayde frenchemen recouered great part land cruell wise vexed countesse britaine countrei wasted destroyed partes veray sore shortly died wound receyued citee uannes anni regum angli 17 yere worlde 5304 yere christ 1343 clement bishop rome toke vpō geue diuers bishoprikes benefice fel voyde englande wherwith king greatly discontented much sent commission streight commaundementes man present induct suche person▪ bishoppe promoted without agremente kinge touched prerogatiue whan lewys emperour instance noble great humilitee made diuers meanes entreatie concorde clement bishop outragious pride prescribed shameful vnworthye condition vneth vilest slaue world would haue condescended vnto amonge whiche openly acknowlage errours dysobedyence therwith resigne empire neuer receyue bishop pleasure moreouer yeld selfe child al goodes handes kinge edward wyndes kepte sea space xi weekes retourned agayne englande amurates kinge turkes inuaded seruia bulgaria lazarus king seruia slayne battaile amurates long murdered owne seruaunte yere worlde 5333 yere christ 1342 anni regum angli 46 bertram clesqu • constable fraunce warred fiercely vpon iohn erle mountforte duke brytayne bycause semed fauour kyng england forced forsake landes fly kinge edward▪ domage dyd townes countreys passed yere worlde yere christ 1373 pazaites iiii kynge turkes anni regum angli 47 genowayes certaine disworship doen inuaded spoyled contrey cypre conquered ye citie famaugusta thei constreigned also king petrine pay vnto theim great tribute space certaine yeres diuers entreties peace made betwene king englande fraunce▪ meane byshoppe rome none concluded anni regum angli 48 yere worlde great dearth • ed countrey italye ii yeres yere christ 1374 yere worlde people florence desirous lybertie anni regum angli 49 gaue occasion many cyties italye sake byshoppe byshop gregory excommunicated florētines lytell regarded course cōs • eignedtheir prestes minister diuine seruice prince edwarde englande departed life tyme floure chiualrye andronicus expelled father imperiall dy • gnitie constantinople uenec • an restored againe empyre whereby ensued great warre betwene uenice genoway one toke part father sonne kinge edwarde iii ended life richemonte xxii daye iune yere worlde 5338 yere christ 1377 duke angeow constable frāce owen wale many frenche parte made sore warre gascoyne guyan poyters britaine conquered agayne diuers castels townes citees subiecte king england owen wale besieged mortaine yere halfe ther slayne treasō one seruauntes rycharde ii sonne prynce edwarde wale ordeined king england yet seuen yeres age anni regum angli 1 bounty lyberalitie farre passed progenitours ouer muche geuen rest quietnesse loued lyttel deedes armes marcyall prowes younge ruled young consaile regarded nothynge aduertisementes sage wyse men realme chiefe hym wysedome estimacion thing turned land great trouble selfe fine extreme myserye frenche king sent great nauie sea entred dyuers partes realme dyd muche harme place landed entising frenchman scottes began rebell squier theyrs called alexander ramsei xl stelth nighte toke castell barwike rescued recouered erle northumberlande warre renewed againe betwene kinges frāce nauarre yere worlde 5339 yere christ 1378 anni regum angli 2 shortly alied king rycharde englande spaniardes castile warred vpon kinge nauerre besieged citie pampelon charles emperour almaine came frāce wher beyng receiued great honour triumphe established kynge noble perpetuall amitie friendship kynge nauerre normandye became frenche sauing one castell gregorye leuenth great schisme rose churche rome election byshop cardinalles italy chose italian byshop named urbane vi cardinalles fraunce citie fondes electted robert cardynal basyle named clement vii two blessed bishop disalowed one others election cursed eche cruel censure mortal warre betwene theim arreared vtter disturbance christendome germanye hungarye englande pannony italy fauored urbane france spaine cateloine helde clement thus beganne schisme whiche continued 39 yere neuer one holye byshops woulde geue ouer lest tone shoulde seme meke lowly germaines vexed theim selfes moste cruell warres pazaites king turkes desirous reueng death father made fierce warre vpon bulgares vanquished kynge marcus great batayle subdued • ignorye great parte bulgarie lorde neuell england sent company souldiers raise siege mortaine po • ctou ayde king nauerre agaynst spaniardes castile yere worlde 5340 yere christ 1379 peace betwene spanyardes naueroyes anni regum angli 3 shortlye theruppon died kinge henrye castile sonne iohn succeded kingdome fierce deadly warre betwene genowayes uenecians wherby al east part europe fore disquieted sea greuously vexed troubled genowayes vanquished flote ueneciās hauen pole lewys king hungarie exciting bishoppe urbane led puissant armye agaynste iohan quene naples fauoured partye clement antipape geuen right title kingedomes naples apulia sicilye prouince countreys whiche committed erle angeow lewys first comming conquered cite retium longe time bene vexed faction guelphes gibelines receyued also dedicion citee naples uinec • laus king boheme purchasinge labouringe father ordeyned emperour almaine farre vnlike father al princely vertues cruell outrageouslye desyroūs pleasure aschewed al labour businesse curious wine delicates good orderynge gouernance cōmon weale slayne kynge henry beganne buylde palaice westminster anni regum angli 24 yere christ 1532 kyng henry went ouer sea mete french kyng yere worlde 5493 went bulleyne french kyng came agayne hym caleys bycause diuorse lady catherin certain • nkes frier eu • disposed person diuellyshe entent put heades many kynges subiectes knowlage • euelation god sainctes highly displeased kynge henry diuorsement frome lady catherine surmised among thynges god reuealed nunne named elizabeth bar • called holye mayde kent ca • • kyng proceded sayde diuorse maried kynge realme one moneth reputation god one day houre elisabeth barton false dissimulation often practised shewed people meruaylous alteration visage partes hir body rapt traunce feyned traunces fals hypocrisie thoughe inspired god spake many woordes rebukyng synne reprouyng newe opinion whiche called heresi • amonge vttered diuers thinges greate reproche kyng quene establyshyng ydolatry anni regum angli 26 pylgremage yere worlde 5495 yere christ 1534 false worshippyng god whyche naughtyn • condempned put death certayn counsaile aprile woulffe wyfe shamefull murde • committed sleayng two marchant stranger arreigned hang • place hadde done murder anabaptistes caused great trouble ruffling north partes germany citie monstere chusyng theyr kyng one iohn leyde exercised much crueltie expellynge citie would con • escende beleefe iohn scottes theyr false maner pretended peace amitee earnest suite neuerthelesse meane tyme spoyled border sodeine • orreis incursyons reuengement wherof sir robert bowes made rode scotlande taken without putting ransome kynge sent duke northfolke thither army royal yorke craftie dissimulacion kynge scottes sent ambassadours intreate peace armye stayed longe consultacion • che tyme spent scottes woulde condescende indifferent condicions wherfore duke wente forewarde entred scotlande burnyng wastynge march taryed wythout battaile profered kynge scottes vntill myddes nouember returned sommer procurement french kyng duke cleue rebelled emperoure greate noumber cleueners gelder • y one martine rossein capytayne came downe antwarpe lay towne trustyng gette healp • great noumber traytours disciple confort wife child euen cond •• n • die doctrine stode laste examination consisteth poyntes fyrst supper lorde duely ministred receyued spirite faithe receyued bodye christe masse mere man mortification newe lyfe shulde folowe baptisme sacrament ought bee denied infantes sithe promise pertayneth also vowe oughte made word god requireth man power perform eareshrift counsell doubtfull
