lu • e • kynge henry sent lorde edwa • de 〈◊〉 erle hertforde lorde lisle hy • h 〈◊〉 company 7000 men pr • u • nt 〈…〉 intended builde forte 〈…〉 • ode whiche tyme entr • hauen two • ay • frenchemen appointed b • • 〈◊〉 seated purpose often skirmish betwene englishe garr • son bulleyn frenche forte greately losse bothe partes one tym • especially wer slayn xvi englishe gentyll men▪ lxxx fewe none frenchemenne stewes lyke brothell house kynges commaundement put downe partes realme place dyd mayntayne whordom manslaughter mischiefe naughtines peace concluded betwene englande fraunce anni regum angli proclaymed whitsonday great reioycyng realmes yere worlde 5507 yere christ 1546 conclusion peace vicount lisle high admirall byshop duresme goodly cōpany men went france whose returne byshop •• reux two erles came england honourably receyued w • h great ioye triumph anne askew gentlewoman iohn lassels gentilmā • nd two brente smithfield • opinion • contrary act • syx article whiche tyme doctour shaxton also recanted duke norfolke sonne erle sur •• wer attaynted treason sonne put execution himselfe committed towre remayned longe tyme ianuarie renowmed • ing henry eyghte ended lyfe buried windsore gratiouse noble prince edwarde • xt beyng ix yeres age yere worlde yere christ 1543 succeded hys fathe • gouernance thys realme crowned westmin • ter shrofe sondaye great solemnitie whome people muche reioyced wishynge hertily hys longe prosperouse reigne ouer sawe hym euidente liklyhodes christian politike gouernemente yeres sh • ul • e make ripe fruites vertue euen tender age appeared sowen hys royall herte kynge tyme hys minoritye hys vncle edwarde duke somerset lorde protectour rest counsel gouerned realme wh • furtheraunce god worde true religion commissioner sent al partes realme commaundement take image oute church auoydinge idolatrie cause al person leaue superstitiouse vse beades wyth commissioner sente certein godlye learned preacher dehorted men superstition enstructed geue theim selfe true vnfayned worshyppyng god heart mynde due obedience towardes theyr prince yere order taken pompous superstitious maner goyng processi • n shuld lefte vsed last day iuly steuen gardiner bisshoppe winchester sent prisoner towre london tyme doctour smith oxford recanted openly paules crosse diuers article conteyned twoo bookes whiche made one defence sacrifice maise proue vnwritten verity oughte beleued vnder payne damnation shortlye lorde protectoure erle warwike wente scotlande stronge army requiringe scottes fulfyll promise made kynge henry concernynge mariage theyr younge quene noble prynce edwarde hys sonne scottes alwayes vnfaithfull promisse stubb • rnel • e came againste greate puisaunce long two army encoūtred feldes muscleborow • place called pinkersloughe englishman thinckynge haue battaile fronte scottishe army terribly set pike horseman gaue firste set enforced recule losse certen gentleman whiche reculynge muche abashed footemen yet great wisedome pollicye capitaynes good stomake souldiours wherewith god present strengthed gaue new onset without notable fight discomfited scottes optayned noble victorie tyme slaine scottes betwene thyrtene fouretene thousande passynge hundred englysshemen yeare dyd pestilence rage citie london men fell buryeng deade early mornynges late euenynges whervpon commaundemente geuen curate shoulde bury none vi mornyng vi nyght bell ryng iij quarter houre myghelmasse holden parliament wherein chauntries giuen kynges handes altered disposed pleasure also ordeyned parliam • nt body bloude christe shoulde receyued persones bothe kyndes breade wyne order appoynted auoidyng sturdy vagabundes beggar meane whyle peter martyr florentine borne excellent knowlege diuinitie sent thomas cranmer archebyshop canterbury came englande▪ nouember shortely made reader diuinitie vniuersitie • forde excellencie soundenes doctrine also parliament repealed certain bloudy statute made tyme kynge henry eight anni regum angli 2 yere worlde yere christ 1548 emongest whiche statute sixe article one fifte day februarye aboue named duke somerset reste counsaylours realme dyd wryte vnto scottes kynges name longe piththy oration exhortynge theim embrace peace vayne afterwarde appeared great losse bothe realmes february hotte persecution beganne agayne fraunce especially paryse doctrine martyn luthere meane whyle englande men wyttes occupied dyuysynge howe abolyshe masse vtterly aprile folowynge martine bucer beeynge sente marque brandenborough one princis electours came frome strawsborough germany au • orough hym appoyntemente entreated perswaded fayre woordes promyses roughe wordes threatenynges meanes possible geue consent booke called antididagma whiche papistes bene hande frome yeare lorde thousande fiue hundred fortye two present • yere 1548 hadde nowe made perfect thought al withstanding bucer departed geuyng consent theyr boke without danger lyfe boke fyrst pende boke reformation religion herman byshop coleyn caused bee drawen afterwardes sette forth name yet made perfect coulde confirmed popery welmoste coulde allowed god vicar rome bicause thynges graunted contrary parte fyrst day october edmunde boner byshop london depriued byshoprike put prison marshalsey obstinately stode defence popisshe supersticion nycholas ridley byshop rochester kynges authoritie transl • • london fourth day nouember parliament holden westminster vpon prorogation wherin authorised boke vniforme order common praier administration sacramentes englishe tongue also mariage priestes parliament made laufull moreouer acte made xxxii reigne kyng henry eight concernyng contractes matrimonie parliament repealed many beastly person maliciousely enterpreting obtaynyng firste carnall copulation take frome honest men despoused wyues sir thomas seimour lord seimour sudley high admyrall englande yere worlde yere christ anni regum angli 3 parliament attainted treason head striken tower hill london xx marche sayd fought distroy yong kynge edwarde neuewe make hym selfe kynge moste men thynke dyed innocent matter aprile martine bucer paulus fagius men excellent learnyng many letter sente theim thomas cranmer archbyshop cantorburye came englande frendly receyued kyng hymselfe whole nobilitie welmoste people also refreshed thē selues archebyshop canterbury bothe sente cambri • ge teache trewe doctrine christe maie folowynge peter martyr diuines oxforde disputed openly lordes supper presence christe therein question dyd peter martyr propone defend substance bread wyne changed body bloude christ carnally corporally breade wyne sacramentally vnited knitte therevnto report disputation afterwards setforth print wherin moderatours disputation appoynted kyng doo plainely declare martyr vpper hande iune folowyng french kyng came parys great pompe fyrst commynge hym thyther deathe father beyng presence thynke many put death luther doctrine kynge appered writyng set forthe printe sent partes fraunce professed open enemy sorte men determynyng roote theim quite dominion long cut mounsier ueruines heade surrendred boloigne kyng henry eyght long siege sore battrie assaultes tyme began england great sedition emong people partes chiefely norfolke deuonshire chief capitaine deuonshire sir iohn arundell knyght norfolke one kite tanner bothe required groundes lately enpastured enparked layd open agayn chiefe cause rebellion haue popish masse ceremony restored wronghte muche blynde prophecie whiche tolde shuld mete london dede dyd brought prisoner thither one day committed tower suche good successe haue whych folowe blynde prophecy meane whyle dyd french kyng inuade wynne forte whyche kyng henry buylded beetwene boloigne calice called newhauen losse whereof layde duke somersettes charge beeyng protectour hadde seene piece better furnished conclusion iohn dudley erle warwyke assent helpe others counsellours noble • lme charged hym seimor high admyral meane whyle paulus fagius dyed cambridge ende nouember yere worlde 5511 yere christ 1550 quartane anni regum angli beginnyng february byshop strausborowe brought matter passe made byshop rochester xxviii moneth dyed cambridge martine bucer honourably buried commended epitaphes many learned men emong whome two sonnes charles duke suffolke whose mother beyng great fauourer pure religion shewed great kyndnes frendshyp bucer bothe sickenes died hickock xxv maie earthquake sotherie parte middelsex tyme dutcheman burned smithfielde holdyng opinion arrians season fell amonge englyshe nation daungerous sweate bothe realme strange countreys insomuche many died verye shorte space muche fruite repentance former lyfe appeared sodeynely abated vnreasonable rente many soughte poore nedy prison el relie •• soone sweate ceassed felle wonted synnes agayne seemed repented former repentaunce iuly piece coigned xii proclamation abated ix piece iiij iij august ix vi frome iij ij piece ij penye penny halfepeny october duke somerset agayn appreapprehended committed tower syr michel stanhop syr rafe fane syr mile partriche iohn erle warwyke mde duke northumberlande whose deathe sayd duke somerset conspired second day nouember olde quene scottes came london honourablye •• yued lodged byshops palaice shortly duke somerset arrayned westminster pieres acquit treason condemned felonie committed towre agayne remayned tyll brought forth hys deathe meane younge kynge entised passe time maskeyng mumminge ende piked oute sorte misrulers deuyse straunge spectacle courte tyme christmas cause yonge kynge forgette yea rather hate hys good vncle purged courte suche outrage enured kynge vnto exercyse vertuouse learninge hearynge sermon high waye firste make ende kynges vncle kyng hymselfe xiii day ianuarye sea brake sandewitche anni regum angli 6 yere worlde 5513 yere christ 1552 muche dyd ouerflow al marsh drowned much cattell great losse towne countrey xxiij monethe edwarde duke somerset beheaded towre hyll london tyme speakynge people felle suche sudden feare amonge people reason rumoure ran abrode duke northumberlādes power horseman redinesse citye horse man came hastilye northe syde towre hill fell shufflynge thrustynge men stoode daunger lyues muche great number garde stode ther weapon se execution done ther one left order • ffolde sturre many troden vnder fote many thrust tower dytche laste whenne people perceyued came mo horsemenne supposed comen brought pardon duke therefore beganne shoute cast vp theyr cappes whyche thynge duke perceyued beckened cappe hande silence obtayned wylled people quiete theim selues obeye ruler loue theyr yonge kynge pray god hym myght long lyue reigne ouer theym hym selfe loked pardon goddes hand prepared selfe axe wherin behaued hymselfe soberly humbly none harde herted hym dyd shedde teares xxv day february • e hanged towre hyll duke matter syr rafe fane sir myles partriche knyghtes syr thomas arundell syr myghell stanhope beheaded sommer folowyng kyng wente progresse weste countreye wherein yonge affection fedde hym withoute great daunger lyfe outragious ridyng haukyng huntyng towardes wynter retourned london frō then went grenewich wher prepared matter pastyme fort counterfaited riding tylte goodly pastime christmas tyll kyng gotten cough brought hym ende fyrst day marche holden parliament westmynster yere worlde 5514 yere christ 1553 anni regum angli 7 continued tyll dissolution whiche laste daye monethe parlyament emong thynges enacted maner man shoulde selle vtter retayle dronken owne house kynde wyne vppon payne forfaiture tenne pounde euery suche offence meane whyle three noble shyppes furnyshed great aduenture vnknowen viage easte northseas great encourager voiage sebastian gaboto englisheman borne bristow genoways sonne shyp • dyd shortly passe galla • tly grenewiche kynges presence one maryners standyng vpon mayne topmaste one tyme lyke shyppes sette forthe towardes southe seke aduentures meane whyle kynge edwarde sycke councellours linckinge selues maryages muche talke ther kynge poysoned suffered imprisonment punishmentes sayeng also sayeng deade fine tenthe day iuly proclamation declared london dyed vi day moneth tyme prayer setforth printe vnder testimonye syr thomas wroth one priuie chaumber doctoure owen one kynges phisitians others wherein kyng lyttell departed besought god preserue realme popery abouenamed proclamation whiche sette forth consente duke northhumberlande learned counsell realme fewe excepted emong whome iustice hale kent one mayre alderman common counsell citie london moste parte nobilitie ladye iane daughter vnto henrie duke suffolke proclaimed queene contrarye order taken parliamente succession crowne later daye kyng henry eight pretendynge feare whiche folowed dede yf mary raigne would bring foren power bishop rome god wil haue truth mayntayned puttyng heyres theyr right cōfounded wisedom woman whō wold haue shuldred frō right punished vnsaciable gatherynge tresure vnder theyr good kyng turned hertes people ouercam without bloudshed withstandinge made great expedition sea land counsell london perceyued common people woulde stande theim certayne noble men began go way turned tale proclaymed lady mary eldest daughter kyng henry appointed parliament succede edwarde dyeng without issue duke northhumberlande beyng whole counsel sent fo • agaynst lefte alone cambridge sonnes fewe emong erle huntyngton one arested broughte tower london traytours crowne meane whyle lady iane husband gylforde sonne duke northhumberland wer made prisoner tower lyen frome tyme proclamation quene mary thus dyd mary first begynne reigne ouer realme xx iuly yeare oure lorde 1553 beeyng framyngham cast • passed citie london westminster great pompe among strange sightes set foorthe moste memory man stoode vpon backe • hercocke paules steple withoute staye hauyng streamer hande morowe crowned westminster stephen gardiner beynge minister x day october began parliament wherein repealed al statute • de time kyng hē ry theight premunire statute made king edwarde syx • time administration cōmon praier sacramentes englishe tonge furder thattaynder iohn duke northumberlande thys parlyamente confyrmed meane whyle many men forward erectyng altar mass church suche woulde stycke lawes made kynge edwardes tyme tyll sholde established marked presently apprehended amonge whome sir iames hale knight kent iustice common place one whoe withstandinge ventred hys lyfe quene mary cause wold subscribe disheritinge kinges yet dyd quarter session geue charge vpon statute made ye time hēry theight edward vi supremacie religiō imprisoned martialsy counter flete cruelly hādled put feare talke yt warde flete vsed haue hering torment wer preparing heretikes sought rid life woūding • knife afterward content say willed wher vpō discharged neuer quieted conscience tyll drowned selfe ryuer halfe myle house kent xviii october ther poules churche lōdon disputatiō appointed ye quenes cōmandement ye presēce christ sacramēt altare thei call disputatiō cōtinued vi day wherin doctor weston chief pope part behaued outragiously tantyng checking cōclusion disputed contrary part wer driuen flee denie dye though moste men iudgementes herde disputation vpper hand thend october one michael seruetus spaniard put deathe geneua denying eternall deitie christ iesus tyme died iames sturmiꝰ strawsborow man excellēt lerning vertu age lxiii yeres nouember archbyshop cranmer notwithstā dyng earnestly refused subscribe kynges wyll disher • tynge syster mary alledgynge many pithy reason legitimation guild hall london arrained attainte highe treason lady iane thre duke northhumberlands sonnes al returned tower agayn meane whyle cardinall poole beynge sente quene mary emperour requested staie hym thentent thynke presence englande shoulde lette mariage intended betwene philip sonne quene mary makyng whereof sent moste ample embassage full power make vp mariage betwixt whiche toke suche successe commoned matter fewe dayes knytte vp knotte doone aboute begynnyng ianuary euill taken people yere worlde 5515 yere christ 1554 anni regum angli 8 many nobilitie cōspiryng among themselues made rebellion wherof syr thomas wyat knyght chiefe begynner kent persuaded people quene counsell wolde foreyne mariages bryng vpon realme moste miserable seruitude establyshe popyshe religion aboute xxv ianuarye newes came london sturre kent shortely duke suffolke fled warwikeshire lei • e •• ershyre gather power quene therfore • aused themb • th carewes deuonshire bee proclaymed traitoures sente kente agaynste wyat thomas duke norfolke beynge forsaken theym went hym escaped london agayne greate difficul • ie thought although mā folowed duke suffolke sent earle huntyngdon poste entryng citie couentrie duke disappoynted hym purpose wherfore duke greate distresse committed hymselfe keepyng seruaunt hi • owne park • lyke false traytoure bewrayed hym hee brought vp tower london mean peter carewe hearyng doone fledde fraunce taken wyat came towardes london begynnynge february whence themperors ambassador sped thēselues away hast al water quene heryng wyat cōmyng came citie gylde hall wher made vehement oration wyat declaringe neyther wold consent mary otherwise shuld seme counsell wealth realme wherefore desyred citie sticke suppressing rebell • use traitours desending royall estate done appointed lord william haward lieutenant citie erle penbroke generall field lest shuld escape citie wiat caused drawbridge london cut let fal riuer temes mean wyat commen southwarke two dayes spent vayne departed ward kyngston passed ryuer force thinckynge haue comen london good tyme disappointed partly breaking cariage ordinaūc • par • elye wearinesse longe foule iourney comminge charing crosse paste hope preuailinge yet suffered go quietly sate iudgement vpon ignorantly accept wittingly deuised take frō others giue xxi moneth henry duke suffolke beheaded tower hill beynge condempned iiii dayes condemned conspiracie many gentilmen yeoman whereof executed london countrey fine quene pardoned iiii hundreth common people xv daye marche committed toure courtney erle deuonshire xviii lady elizabeth syster quene vppon suspition wyat conspiracie shortely apprehended northwales lorde thomas graye brother duke sir iames crofte whiche lorde thomas executed immediatly parliament summoned holden oxforde made great preparation great hindrance many inhabitantes afterward appointed westmynster holden second april wherin quene requested ii thing mariage restoring pope one obtained vpon certaine condition wolde granted meane onely straungers kyng edwardes time receiued realme religion emong one iohn lasco vncle ye king poland one many englishmē also fled friseland cleueland som high germanie • ound great fauour especially frankfort vpon mea • e somme wente geneua wher found great fauour also time hanged chard somersetshire iii yong men breakyng burnyng churche ornament x daye aprill archebishoppe cranmer byshop rydley hugh latimer went towre towardes oxforde disputacions wyth deuynes vniuersities wold recant wer reserued prisone till might condemned pope autoritie withstanding answered substantially trulye tyme sir thomas wyat beheaded towre hill afterwarde quartered quarter set vp sundry place head vpon gallowes haye hyll ouer thre hanged chaines shortly stolen awaye thence came forth deth plainly declare ladye elizabeth courtney nothyng giltye faction notwithstanding coulde set ladie elizabeth libertye duryng tyme many mad part wer playd citie london chiefely cat dressed lyke prieste masse cake ouer heade betwene handes hanged vpon gallowse cro chepe • tie dog shauen crowne tippet necke found quenes closet letter fastned tippet wherin word pore priest yt com sue benefice tyme cardinal pole went emperour ye french king intreat peace vain xviii may hāged drawen quartered tiburn williā thomas cōspiring quenes • th xx iuly philip prince spaine son charles v emperor ariued southampton ther honorably receiued cam ye fourth day winchester quene lōg loked wher matrimonie betwene thē honorably solēnised kingdome naples mariage sake father graunted thinges done rode royallye london whither thei cam • umptuously receyued xviii day august ende october themperour sent messēgers king sonne geue possession dukedom millayn xii daye nouember holden westmynster parliament whiche cardinall pole brought brabant beynge accompanied english ambassadours sent purpose among whome lorde paget one came london xxiii nouember first daye came parliament house beyng restored olde estate f • om kyng henry cast hym doune presence th • kyng queene dyd declared cause lega • ie exhort al represent • hole body 〈◊〉 retourne communion churche • restore moste holy father due authoritie signifyenge vnto holynes purpose shewe great clemencie gentlenesse vnto exhorted geue thankes god hadde geuen suche kyng quene laste dyd vnderstande toke great benefite theyr handes restored hym hys former estate therfore accompted selfe bounde great deale restore heauenly court thinge desyred thynges thus spoken went parliment house stode vp lorde chauncellor byshop winchester repeted cardinalles oration many wordes exhortation concorde vnitie affirmyng oughte geue moste harty thankes god vnmeasurable mercy styred v vp prophete oure owne nation whiche geueth hymselfe wholly doo v good day folowyng parliament graunted cardinalles request deuised forme supplication kyng queene wherein myghte moste humbly beseche meanes cardinall theim effect whereof dyd earnestly repent theyr scisme refusynge obey apostolike sea rome consentynge lawes made promysyng thence foorth would theyr cōmandement soeuer shulde able • parliament abolyshyng suche lawes statute next day sone kyng quene pool • againe present chauncellour stode vp declared parliament decreed concerning pope legate request▪ deliuered king quene supplication parli • ment sealed humbly besechyng receyue whan receyued opened deliuered chancellour agayne redde whiche dyd asked w • ole house whether consented aunswered yea kyng queene rose vp▪ delyuered cardinall wh • n redd • delyuered bull legacy theym whyche forthewith redde men myghte vnderstande pope hadde geuen hym power absolue theym afterwarde declared howe acceptable sight god repentance synner howe greatly angel reioyce ouer one sinner repēteth conclusion gaue thanks god geuen mynde desyrous emendement done arose dyd kyng quene also fell kyng quene doune theyr knee thā dyd cardinall lyfte vp fyngers blesse desyryng god loke mercyfully vpon people forgeue offence absolued whole multitude wente chappell thankes geuen god pypynge syngyng maner suche knewe pole acquayntance hym meruailed muche doynges looked farre thynges hande nowe kyng quene common good poynt case mete procede aduā cyng antichriste treadynge christe vnder fote member thei dyd renued thre statute punisshement christes people • whome call heretikes repealynge statute made agaynst apostolike sea rome terme som men thought philip shuld haue c • oun parliament came passe meane many kept prison bene apprehended preachyng queene mary procl • ymed • action debte 〈…〉 charge th • might • e holde vnder colour lawe tyll lawe establysshed myght make ende wolde submyt themselues churche rome soone begynnynge ianuary parlyament dissolued immediately fyue men god singularly learned scripture brought forth prisone aboute london hadde bene holden sayde bycause woulde submytte theimselues pope authoritie condemned heresie theyr name iohn hopper bysshoppe worcester gloucester iohn bradforde laurence saunders roulande taylour doctour lawe iohn rogers reader diuinitie paules shortely condemned robert farrer byshop sainct dauids wale whyle life cruell papistes coulde shame put hym deathe yet reserued hym prison trustyng tyme woulde weare memory godly lyfe behaued hym selfe prison fame vertue grewe euen hower deathe meane whyle emperour charles laboured brother ferdinandus kynge boheme brynge germaines generall councell▪ fyrste ulmes auguste whiche cardinall moronus shulde haue comen trye whyther coulde haue done muche germany pole doone englande good successe pole englande encouraged pope thoughte god hym churche coulde meanes conuinced errour v marche thomas tomkyn weauer dwelled shorditche without bishoppes gate london burned branche burned westminster fyrst hand striken stake caster daie wounded priest sainct margarets churche tyme mynistration housell call day bourned westchester george marche preacher meane many learned worshipfull noble personage besides honest commoner great numbre conueyed selues beyonde sea vnder licence secretly emongest duchesse suffolke wyfe charles duke suffolke one hus band barthew syr fraunces knolles diuers chosyng rather aduenture affliction straunge countreye submytte themselues romyshe superstitious order commit grosse ydolatrie papist mainteyn aboute tyme greate preparation made queenes chyldbedde mydwiues rocke • sortes woman great numbre taken quenes lodgyng hampton courte suffered come home hus bandes besydes great preparation al thyng pertaynyng nursery • plainly affirmed mouth queenes 〈◊〉 greate man chylde sayde two conclusion • orne neyther manchild woman could knowe • al • hough priestes euery churche • ealm • ▪ 〈◊〉 diligently earnestly moued people tyme tyme beginnyng • nouember testimonie counsell certified conceyued pray myght bryng forth prince shulde iuste title reigne ouer greatest parte christen worlde laste daye aprile mornynge • efore gat • london opened ther came merie f • low gate bridge foote affirminge mu • e ride post thorough citie quene mornyng delyuered prince shift vsed get gate opened worde flewe faste thorowe london pleasaunt • are priestes parishe clarkes vii clocke belle citie walkynge shortely te deum solemnely song procession set forth salue festa dy wyth best cross cope besydes bonefyres bankets appoynted agaynst none many thretnyng word spoken forwa • de thys ouer spedye • eioycynge tyme erle arundell beyng presydent counsell lay • house wythout temple ba • hering great noise belle asked cause therof aboute hym told newes gaue credite woulde sende mayre london knowe truthe could learne none truth whiche priestes clarkes hadde confirmed theyr singynge rynginge sente immediately courte contente tarye • ourne messenger rode afte • poste hymselfe learned quene aboute hearde nothinge ioyful newes newes stayed ran post al part england▪ 〈◊〉 al countreys europe also wer puniss • ed • partes englande sayinge lye manifestlye knowne lye people verie desyrous • ulde borne staye succession crowne w • ole number mydwyues rocker retayned still courte laste sen • e awaye neyth • r prince princesse borne xxxi may courrishelye dyd keper bennyngfielde behaue selfe towards moueth iune lord chauncellor englande erle arundell lorde paget went ouer sea calice commissiō treat peace concluded betwene french kyng bucer paulus fagiu • mētion solēnly somoned appere answere suche heresy shuld layd theyr charge sat iugement vpon thē cō demned bothe burned wherefore taken vp theyr graues solemnely burned market • il certen vniuersitie lyfe tyme verie frendly familier began defame heretikes amonge whome doctor perne one nere thys tyme peter martyr wife shold haue serued oxford none able say euer herd • spea • ▪ worde heresie straunger borne neuer spake englishe latin could condemned wife man vehemently suspected therefore remoued papisticall halowed grounde saye buryed dungehille thys februarie lorde sturton bene bolstred mischiefe longe godfather stephen gardiner liued arrayned west minster murder • two gentleman marche folowyng brought • salisbury ther hanged sixt day monethe march xxii day kyng philip beynge returned flanders came london passed west minster great solemnity accompanied quene noble realme xii aprille burned smithfielde iohn lothes • ye henry ramsey william stur • le one stanley wife xx may thomas fowle hadde ventred lyfe preaching ministring afflict • christian london duryng former yeares • trouble beynge visited sicken • died great discomf • rte afflicted flocke meane frenche kyng made great preparation warres entendyng whiche brought passe notwithstandyng purpose perceyued depu • y calaice guisnes yet suche securitie englysshe potentate • n • thyng prouided deputie calaice lorde graye wylton capitaynes castell piece sir antonie ager slayne merchauntes staple people spoyled sent awaye great miserie immediatly winninge holdes came suche tempestes bothe sea 1558 anni regum angli 6 one fyrst deacon congregation hadde lyued secrete london manne woorthy integritie lyfe betraied iohn roughe suffered muche tower prison bicause beyng deacon could haue vttered many good menne whose bloud papistes thyrsted woulde vtter none hym bourned one iohn demenes called hugh foxe marche princis electours princis germany came togyther frankforde vppon mesne hauynge surrender imperyall crowne made charles fyfte th • n determyned end lyfe house religion spayn proceded election newe emperour shorte tyme chose ferdinandus brother charles kyng boheme ferdin • ndus though papiste profession yet bycause pryncis electours wold present masse content crouned noone without masse sprynge greate preparation made bothe frenche kinge kynge philyppe also frenche kynge made suche speede inuaded flaunders spoyled brente dunkirke kyng philip coulde come re kue frenchemenne retourned agayne oute flaunders mette flemynges quene englandes shyppes vpon sandes betwene dunkirke grou • lyn th • slayn great numbre dyd bothe myghty prince bend theim selues wi • h power inuade eche spent sommer campe owne persones two mighty army ben october muche talkyng peace shuld haue ben concluded dyd nouember breake vp camp • without eyther peace concluded fielde foughten notable acte doone xv aprile one iohn maynerde died newgate buried fielde xxvi aprile bourned canturburye two woman xxvi may • ourned colchester iohn haryson agnes george one name • daye iune burn • • orwi • thre person sam • moneth one thomas tyl • r one mathewe witlers died newgate burned shortly queene mary felle daungerousely sicke shewe signe purpose god toke h • r two chiefe phisitions wolde helpe byshops burned euen laste breathe euen nouember laste moneth lyfe burned ipswiche two bery two canturbery certayn person god therefore geue souldiours breathyng tyme toke rodde xvii day nouember set vp place seconde daughter noble kynge henry ryght title succeded edwarde mary dyeng without issue ¶queene elizabeth noble princesse began reigne ouer realme xvii day nouember yeare oure lorde 1558 hatfielde hartfordshire frō whens grace came shortely citie london ioyfully receiued people wise menne myght well perceyue hope people conceyued receyue handes thyng syster taken theim contrary parte behauiour towardes people suche people delited yet must nowe haue shewed selues eyther thankfull god good chaunge el altogyther vnwoorthy gentylle louynge coumfortable pryncesse passyng cite tower frome then westmynster coronation whiche xv day ianuary folowynge people shewed themselues ioyfull selfe thankefull euidently appeared princesse people •• ryued shoulde deserue others hande▪ thynges doynge god wroughte yet church next day quene mary death cardinal poole dyed also within iii day byshop rochester shortely byshop chichester generally many priestes dyed realme tyme quene mary sicknesse tyme deathe doctour scotte byshop chester preachyng paules crosse xxvii nouember affirmed euery iiii church englande one priest byshop boner london besturred hym made newe priestes bene madde mente thereby lett • wyse men coni • cture xx ianuary began parlyament wherein among thynges supremacy byshoppe rome longe debated euery man suffred say coulde woulde defence laste durynge tyme parliament preachinge ceased realme sauing quene lent preached cock san • parker maister whithead maister grindall byll maister pedder maister scorie maister leuer master horne maister samson maister wintrie bent themselues vttermost knowledge beat antichrist power dyd therin much none yt • altogither hardened would one open mouthe agaynste taught thus dyd lord mercy take people sharpe rodde wherwith duringe dayes quene mary chastised may well appe • noumber theym suffered tyme reigne whiche manye mo noumber brefe chronicle remēbred god hath theyr name boke theyr teares bottell number shalbe fulfylled reuenged vppon th • murtherers lord graunt v grace walk • feare vertuous queene may • continewe v sette forthe goddes truth hys glorye saluacion amen imprinted london vvilliam seres weste ende poules towards ludgate signe hedgehogge solde 1559 v day apryll
